Data.Description: The AdverseEvent resource returns data about an event that caused unintended physical injury resulting from or contributed to by medical care, a research study, or other healthcare setting factors. These events might require additional monitoring, treatment, or hospitalization, or might result in the death of a patient.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

AdverseEvent.Name: AdverseEvent
AdverseEvent.Description: A single instance of a FHIR AdverseEvent resource.

actuality.Name: actuality
actuality.Description: The nature of the adverse event, either real or potential.

adverse-event-comments.Name: extension
adverse-event-comments.Description:
This element is returned starting in the May 2022 version of Epic.
Free-text comments associated with an adverse event.

adverse-event-expected.Name: extension
adverse-event-expected.Description: Whether this adverse event is expected.

adverse-event-resolved-date.Name: extension
adverse-event-resolved-date.Description: The date the adverse event was documented as ended.

adverse-event-severity-history.Name: extension
adverse-event-severity-history.Description: A record of the historic severities for a particular adverse event.

adverse-event-severity-history-line.Name: extension
adverse-event-severity-history-line.Description: A specific instance in the severity history for a particular adverse event.

adverse-event-severity.Name: extension
adverse-event-severity.Description: The grade of an adverse event at a point in time.

adverse-event-severity-start-date.Name: extension
adverse-event-severity-start-date.Description: The date the adverse event was documented as started.

outcome.Name: outcome
outcome.Description: The outcome of the adverse event. Currently providing only "resolved" and "ongoing."

recorder.Description: The recorder of the adverse event. This is the user who first recorded the adverse event.

seriousness.Name: seriousness
seriousness.Description: The seriousness of the event. This is populated with "Serious" or "Non-Serious."

suspectEntity.Name: suspectEntity
suspectEntity.Description: The suspected agent causing the adverse event.

Data.Description:
The AdverseEvent resource returns data about an event that caused unintended physical injury resulting from or contributed to by medical care, a research study, or other healthcare setting factors. These events might require additional monitoring, treatment, or hospitalization, or might result in the death of a patient.

A user or staff member accessing this FHIR resource must have security to vew adverse events for research studies.

This resource requires additional setup if the organization has custom category list values for adverse event grades or research study attribution.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

Data.Description: Returns data about an allergy or intolerance to a specific substance associated with one patient. You can also search by ID and by patient, allowing it to return a list of allergies
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients
Data.ChangeLog:
Epic Version Description Type
November 2024 AllergyIntolerance now returns onsetDateTime. The onsetPeriod element is no longer used. Breaking change
August 2023 AllergyIntolerance now returns onsetDateTime in Dutch locales and returns onsetPeriod as a range for all other locales. Breaking change
November 2022 AllergyIntolerance no longer returns reaction-level severities for an allergen documented in Epic. Instead, allergen-level severity is now returned as the criticality element. Breaking change

category.Name: category
category.Description:
The category of the allergy.

The following default values are supported, but additional values may be configured by each Epic organization:

  • food
  • medication
  • environment
  • biologic

Starting in the May 2021 version of Epic, multiple category values can be returned in this element.

clinicalStatus.Name: clinicalStatus
clinicalStatus.Description:
The current status of the allergy. Possible values include:

  • active
  • resolved
  • inactive

If no known allergies on file, value will be "active".

code.Name: code
code.Description: The allergen name and codes.

criticality.Name: criticality
criticality.Description: Refers to the risk of clinical harm of a reaction to the substance.

note.Name: note
note.Description: Any comments associated with the allergy.

onsetDateTime.Name: onsetDateTime
onsetDateTime.Description:
If an allergy has a noted date, that date is specified here.

This element is returned in the following locales dependent on Epic version:

  • August 2023 and later: returned in Dutch locales.
  • November 2024 and later: returned in all locales.

onsetPeriod.Name: onsetPeriod
onsetPeriod.Description:
If an allergy has a noted date, that date or date range for non-specific dates is specified here.

This element is returned in the following locales dependent on Epic version:

  • May 2023 and earlier: returned in all locales.
  • August 2023 – August 2024: returned in non-Dutch locales only.
  • November 2024 and later: no longer returned in any locale.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: Reference to a patient resource for whom the allergy is relevant.
patient.Optional: True

manifestation.Name: manifestation
manifestation.Description: A single reaction the patient had to the substance.

recordedDate.Name: recordedDate
recordedDate.Description: The date the allergy was recorded in Epic. Called "assertedDate" in STU3.

recorder.Name: recorder
recorder.Description: Reference to the practitioner who updated the allergy.

type.Name: type
type.Description: Identification of the underlying physiological mechanism for the reaction risk.

verificationStatus.Name: verificationStatus
verificationStatus.Description:
If the allergy is on the patient's chart, this element specifies "confirmed". If it is a newly created allergy and and still needs to be reconciled, it is "unconfirmed".

For no allergies on file or unconfirmed lack of allergies, this value will be "unconfirmed". For confirmed no known allergies or no active allergies, this value will be "confirmed".

Data.Description:
The AllergyIntolerance resource defines clinical information about a patient's allergic response to a substance. It defines the substance that elicited the response, as well as when the reaction occurred, the severity, and the type of reaction noted. The AllergyIntolerance resource can also accommodate search by ID and by patient, allowing it to return a list of allergies. If a patient has no active allergies, an AllergyIntolerance resource will be returned indicating whether the patient's allergies have never been reviewed (are not on file), or if they have been reviewed and it has been determined that they have no known allergies.

This resource can also return unconfirmed AllergyIntolerance resources in the "holding tank" that drives the EpicCare Reconcile Outside Data Activity. Note - once a clinician reconciles an allergy, a new AllergyIntolerance resource associated with the reconciled allergy will be available in the normal AllergyIntolerance.Search results, and the unconfirmed AllergyIntolerance in the "holding tank" will no longer appear in the AllergyIntolerance.Search results.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients
Data.ChangeLog:
Epic Version Description Type
November 2024 AllergyIntolerance now returns onsetDateTime. The onsetPeriod element is no longer used. Breaking change
August 2023 AllergyIntolerance now returns onsetDateTime in Dutch locales and returns onsetPeriod as a range for all other locales. Breaking change
November 2022 AllergyIntolerance no longer returns reaction-level severities for an allergen documented in Epic. Instead, allergen-level severity is now returned as the criticality element. Breaking change

category.Name: category
category.Description:
The category of the allergy.

The following default values are supported, but additional values may be configured by each Epic organization:

  • food
  • medication
  • environment
  • biologic

clinical-status.Name: clinical-status
clinical-status.Description:
The current status of the allergy. Only "active" is accepted.

Starting in the August 2021 version of Epic, this parameter is no longer required, and if is not specified, both active and inactive/resolved allergies are returned.

code.Name: code
code.Description: Code that identifies the allergy or intolerance.

criticality.Name: criticality
criticality.Description:
Refers to the risk of clinical harm of a reaction to the substance. Possible values are:

  • unable-to-assess
  • high
  • low

date.Name: date
date.Description: The date the allergy was recorded in Epic.

manifestation.Name: manifestation
manifestation.Description: A single reaction the patient had to the substance.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: Reference to a patient resource.
patient.Optional: False

recorder.Name: recorder
recorder.Description: Reference to the practitioner who updated the allergy.

severity.Name: severity
severity.Description:
The degree of the patient's reaction. Possible values are:

  • mild
  • moderate
  • severe

type.Name: type
type.Description: Unsupported

verification-status.Name: verification-status
verification-status.Description:
If the allergy is on the patient's chart, this element specifies "confirmed". If it is a newly created allergy and and still needs to be reconciled, it is "unconfirmed".

For no allergies on file or unconfirmed lack of allergies, this value will be "unconfirmed". For confirmed no known allergies or no active allergies, this value will be "confirmed".

manifestation.Description: A single reaction the patient had to the substance.

recordedDate.Name: recordedDate
recordedDate.Description: The date the allergy was recorded in Epic. Called "assertedDate" in STU3.

recorder.Name: recorder
recorder.Description: Reference to the practitioner who updated the allergy.

verificationStatus.Name: verificationStatus
verificationStatus.Description:
If the allergy is on the patient's chart, this element specifies "confirmed". If it is a newly created allergy and and still needs to be reconciled, it is "unconfirmed".

For no allergies on file or unconfirmed lack of allergies, this value will be "unconfirmed". For confirmed no known allergies or no active allergies, this value will be "confirmed".

Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

Data.ChangeLog:
Epic Version Description Type
November 2022

Code systems for the following code sets now return a URL in place of an OID:
ActCode, ICD-10-CM, ICD-10-CA, ICD-10-NL, SNOMED

System URL OID
ActCode STU3: http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/ActCode

R4: http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ActCode		 2.16.840.1.113883.5.4
ICD-10-CM http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icd-10-cm 2.16.840.1.113883.6.90
ICD-10-CA http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icd-10-ca 2.16.840.1.113883.6.94
ICD-10-NL http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icd-10-nl 2.16.840.1.113883.6.3.2
SNOMED http://snomed.info/sct 2.16.840.1.113883.6.96
Breaking change

ID.Name: ID
ID.Description: FHIR identifier for an Appointment resource.

Appointment.Name: Appointment
Appointment.Description: An instance of the R4 Appointment resource.

_status.Name: _status
_status.Description: The mapped appointment status. This extension is returned only for organizations in the Netherlands.

created.Name: created
created.Description: The date when the appointment was created.

description.Name: description
description.Description: The brief description of the visit type as would be shown on a subject line in a meeting request or appointment list.

minutesDuration.Name: minutesDuration
minutesDuration.Description: The estimated length of the appointment in minutes. This can be less than the duration between the start and end times if, for example, the actual time of the appointment is only an estimate.

participant.Name: participant
participant.Description: Patient, providers, and locations associated with the appointment.

actor.Name: actor
actor.Description: The patient, providers, and locations associated with the appointment.

period.Name: period
period.Description: The participation period of the actor.

required.Name: required
required.Description: Whether this participant is required to be present at the meeting. This covers a use-case where two doctors need to meet to discuss the results for a specific patient and the patient is not required to be present.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Participation status of the actor. This will either be “accepted” or “declined” based on the appointment status.

patientInstruction.Name: patientInstruction
patientInstruction.Description: Detailed information and instructions for the patient.

reasonCode.Name: reasonCode
reasonCode.Description: Coded reason this appointment is scheduled.

reasonReference.Name: reasonReference
reasonReference.Description: Reason the appointment is to take place.

serviceCategory.Name: serviceCategory
serviceCategory.Description: A broad categorization of the service that is to be performed during this appointment. Value will always be “appointment.”

serviceType.Name: serviceType
serviceType.Description: The specific service that is to be performed during this appointment.

specialty.Name: specialty
specialty.Description: The specialty of a practitioner that would be required to perform the service requested in this appointment

status.Name: status
status.Description: The appointment status.

Data.Description:
This web service allows searching for scheduled surgical procedures. It includes surgical procedures scheduled in Epic using OpTime and Cupid Invasive Cardiology workflows. To search for performed procedures refer to the Procedure.Search (Surgeries) (R4) API.

Non-surgical appointments such as office visits, preprocedure consultations, and interventional radiology can be searched using the Appointment.Search (Appointments) (R4) API.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

ID.Name: ID
ID.Description: FHIR identifier for an Appointment resource.

Appointment.Name: Appointment
Appointment.Description: An instance of the R4 Appointment resource.

created.Name: created
created.Description: When the surgery record was created.

description.Name: description
description.Description: The procedure that was performed, where, when, and by whom.

end.Name: end
end.Description: Time when the surgery is scheduled to end.

id.Name: id
id.Description: FHIR identifier for the Appointment resource.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: System-specified ID for the surgery record.

participant.Name: participant
participant.Description: People and resources who participated in the surgery.

actor.Name: actor
actor.Description: Reference to the Patient, Practitioner, or Location involved in the surgery.

period.Name: period
period.Description: Period of time the actor participated in the surgery.

required.Name: required
required.Description: Whether the participant is required to be present during the surgery.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
Participation status of the actor.

If the case is cancelled or entered-in-error, everyone will be declined.

If the case is any other status, required participants will be accepted and non-required participants will be tentative.

type.Name: type
type.Description: A code signifying the role of the participant in the appointment.

patientInstruction.Name: patientInstruction
patientInstruction.Description: Instructions given to the patient before the surgery.

priority.Name: priority
priority.Description:
The priority of the surgery using the iCal Standard classification.

Epic Value FHIR Value
High 1
Normal 5
Low 9
Blank Blank

reasonCode.Name: reasonCode
reasonCode.Description: External codes for diagnosis records associated with the procedure.

requestedPeriod.Name: requestedPeriod
requestedPeriod.Description: Period of time for which the surgery was requested to be scheduled.

serviceCategory.Name: serviceCategory
serviceCategory.Description:
The type of appointment.

“Surgery” for surgical procedures.

specialty.Name: specialty
specialty.Description: The specialty that performed the surgery.

start.Name: start
start.Description: Time when the surgery is scheduled to start.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
Status of the surgery.

Epic Value FHIR Value
Scheduled Booked
Canceled Cancelled
Not Scheduled Proposed
Missing Information Proposed
Voided Entered-in-error
Pending Proposed
Arrived Arrived
Completed Fulfilled
No Show No show

Data.Description:
This web service allows searching for appointments and returns patient's up-to-date appointment information, such as the appointment date and time, provider, and location. Appointment types available in this API include, but are not limited to:

  • Outpatient clinic appointments
  • Radiology appointments
  • Non-interventional cardiology appointments
  • Inpatient hospital appointments occurring as part of an admission

Appointment types NOT available in this API include but are not limited to:

  • Scheduled surgeries (use the Scheduled Surgeries subresource)
  • Scheduled interventional cardiology visits
  • Patient-submitted appointment requests that have not been scheduled
  • Book Anywhere appointments scheduled at other health systems
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

actor.Name: actor
actor.Description: The patient, providers, and locations associated with the appointment.

date.Name: date
date.Description: Appointment date.

location.Name: location
location.Description: Location FHIR ID reference for actor.

part-status.Name: part-status
part-status.Description: Participation status of the actor. This will either be “accepted” or “declined” based on the appointment status.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: Reference to the Patient resource.
patient.Optional: False

practitioner.Name: practitioner
practitioner.Description: Practitioner FHIR ID reference for actor.

reason-code.Name: reason-code
reason-code.Description: Coded reason this appointment is scheduled.

reason-reference.Name: reason-reference
reason-reference.Description: Reason the appointment is to take place.

service-category.Name: service-category
service-category.Description: The type of appointment. Should be "appointment" if specified.

service-type.Name: service-type
service-type.Description: The specific service that is to be performed during this appointment.

specialty.Name: specialty
specialty.Description: The specialty of a practitioner that would be required to perform the service requested in this appointment

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: An array of entries included in this bundle.

resource.Name: resource
resource.Description: A container for a single FHIR resource.

Appointment.Name: Appointment
Appointment.Description: An instance of the R4 Appointment resource.

_status.Name: _status
_status.Description: The mapped appointment status. This extension is returned only for organizations in the Netherlands.

created.Name: created
created.Description: The date when the appointment was created.

description.Name: description
description.Description: The brief description of the visit type as would be shown on a subject line in a meeting request or appointment list.

minutesDuration.Name: minutesDuration
minutesDuration.Description: The estimated length of the appointment in minutes. This can be less than the duration between the start and end times if, for example, the actual time of the appointment is only an estimate.

participant.Name: participant
participant.Description: Patient, providers, and locations associated with the appointment.

actor.Name: actor
actor.Description: The patient, providers, and locations associated with the appointment.

period.Name: period
period.Description: The participation period of the actor.

required.Name: required
required.Description: Whether this participant is required to be present at the meeting. This covers a use-case where two doctors need to meet to discuss the results for a specific patient and the patient is not required to be present.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Participation status of the actor. This will either be “accepted” or “declined” based on the appointment status.

patientInstruction.Name: patientInstruction
patientInstruction.Description: Detailed information and instructions for the patient.

reasonCode.Name: reasonCode
reasonCode.Description: Coded reason this appointment is scheduled.

reasonReference.Name: reasonReference
reasonReference.Description: Reason the appointment is to take place.

serviceCategory.Name: serviceCategory
serviceCategory.Description: A broad categorization of the service that is to be performed during this appointment. Value will always be “appointment.”

serviceType.Name: serviceType
serviceType.Description: The specific service that is to be performed during this appointment.

specialty.Name: specialty
specialty.Description: The specialty of a practitioner that would be required to perform the service requested in this appointment

status.Name: status
status.Description: The appointment status.

Data.Description:
This web service allows searching for scheduled surgical procedures. It includes surgical procedures scheduled in Epic using OpTime and Cupid Invasive Cardiology workflows. To search for performed procedures refer to the Procedure.Search (Surgeries) (R4) API.

Non-surgical appointments such as office visits, preprocedure consultations, and interventional radiology can be searched using the Appointment.Search (Appointments) (R4) API.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

actor.Name: actor
actor.Description: Reference to the Patient, Practitioner, or Location involved in the surgery.

date.Name: date
date.Description: Time when the surgery is scheduled to start (UTC).

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: System-specified ID for the surgery record.

location.Name: location
location.Description: Location FHIR ID reference for actor

part-status.Name: part-status
part-status.Description:
Participation status of the actor.

If the case is cancelled or entered-in-error, everyone will be declined.

If the case is any other status, required participants will be accepted and non-required participants will be tentative.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: The patient on the scheduled surgery.
patient.Optional: False

practitioner.Name: practitioner
practitioner.Description: Practitioner FHIR ID reference for actor

reason-code.Name: reason-code
reason-code.Description: External codes for diagnosis records associated with the procedure.

service-category.Name: service-category
service-category.Description: The type of appointment. Should be "surgery" if specified.

specialty.Name: specialty
specialty.Description: The specialty that performed the surgery.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
Status of the surgery.

Epic Value FHIR Value
Scheduled Booked
Canceled Cancelled
Not Scheduled Proposed
Missing Information Proposed
Voided Entered-in-error
Pending Proposed
Arrived Arrived
Completed Fulfilled
No Show No show

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: An array of entries included in this bundle.

resource.Name: resource
resource.Description: A container for a single FHIR resource.

Appointment.Name: Appointment
Appointment.Description: An instance of the R4 Appointment resource.

created.Name: created
created.Description: When the surgery record was created.

description.Name: description
description.Description: The procedure that was performed, where, when, and by whom.

end.Name: end
end.Description: Time when the surgery is scheduled to end (UTC).

id.Name: id
id.Description: FHIR identifier for the Appointment resource.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: System-specified ID for the surgery record.

participant.Name: participant
participant.Description: People and resources who participated in the surgery.

actor.Name: actor
actor.Description: Reference to the Patient, Practitioner, or Location involved in the surgery.

period.Name: period
period.Description: Period of time the actor participated in the surgery.

required.Name: required
required.Description: Whether the participant is required to be present during the surgery.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
Participation status of the actor.

If the case is cancelled or entered-in-error, everyone will be declined.

If the case is any other status, required participants will be accepted and non-required participants will be tentative.

type.Name: type
type.Description: A code signifying the role of the participant in the appointment.

patientInstruction.Name: patientInstruction
patientInstruction.Description: Instructions given to the patient before the surgery.

priority.Name: priority
priority.Description:
The priority of the surgery using the iCal Standard classification.

Epic Value FHIR Value
High 1
Normal 5
Low 9
Blank Blank

reasonCode.Name: reasonCode
reasonCode.Description: External codes for diagnosis records associated with the procedure.

requestedPeriod.Name: requestedPeriod
requestedPeriod.Description: Period of time for which the surgery was requested to be scheduled.

serviceCategory.Name: serviceCategory
serviceCategory.Description:
The type of appointment.

“Surgery” for surgical procedures.

specialty.Name: specialty
specialty.Description: The specialty that performed the surgery.

start.Name: start
start.Description: Time when the surgery is scheduled to start (UTC).

status.Name: status
status.Description:
Status of the surgery.

Epic Value FHIR Value
Scheduled Booked
Canceled Cancelled
Not Scheduled Proposed
Missing Information Proposed
Voided Entered-in-error
Pending Proposed
Arrived Arrived
Completed Fulfilled
No Show No show

Data.Description:
Given a Binary FHIR ID, this web service returns an HTML or RTF (Epic Nov 22+) version of the note or document content (plain text notes are converted to HTML). The DocumentReference (Clinical Notes) (R4) resource can be used to obtain a Binary FHIR ID for notes.

When a read request is made for the Binary resource using an Accept header value of "application/fhir+xml" or "application/fhir+json", the response is returned as a structured FHIR resource response with the content Base64-encoded and returned in the “data” element. The samples on this page represent that scenario. Alternatively, if one of those Accept header values is not specified, the raw content is returned directly using the associated content type, and the content type can be discerned from the Content-Type header of the response.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients
Data.ChangeLog:
Epic Version Description Type
Nov 2022 RTF documents supported as a response Substantive change

Binary.Name: Binary
Binary.Description: A single instance of a FHIR Binary resource.

contentType.Name: contentType
contentType.Description: Mime content type string. This is "text/html" or "text/rtf" for clinical notes.

data.Name: data
data.Description: The note or document content as a base64-encoded string.

Data.Description:
Given a Binary FHIR ID, this web service returns the content of the associated Clinical Reference document.

When a read request is made for the Binary resource that doesn't explicitly specify the FHIR content types "application/fhir+xml" or "application/fhir+json", then the content is returned using the content type stated in the resource.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients
Data.SampleResponse:
{

    "resourceType": "Binary",

    "id": " eg5G4a1wX1DGzkjxib3xh8P4.xnlTsrlTE0Ij6k6EDfw3",

    "contentType": "text/xml",

    "data": "<encoded data omitted from this sample>"

}

Binary.Name: Binary
Binary.Description: A single instance of a FHIR Binary resource.

contentType.Name: contentType
contentType.Description: The content type. Always MineType Sufficient.

data.Name: data
data.Description: The binary data – the content of the clinical reference document.

Data.Description:
Given a Binary FHIR ID, this resource returns the associated binary document, which is a correspondence (for example, a letter). Typically, a client obtains the ID from a DocumentReference (Correspondences) read or search interaction.


When a read request is made for the Binary resource that doesn't explicitly specify the FHIR content types "application/fhir+xml" or "application/fhir+json", then the content is returned using the content type stated in the resource.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

Binary.Name: Binary
Binary.Description: A single instance of a FHIR Binary resource.

data.Name: data
data.Description: The content as a base64-encoded string.

Data.Description:
Given a Binary FHIR ID, this web service returns documentation related to a lab order, which can represent the order narrative, impression, or addenda. The DocumentReference (Labs) (R4) resource can be used to obtain a Binary FHIR ID for lab documentation.

When a read request is made for the Binary resource using an Accept header value of "application/fhir+xml" or "application/fhir+json", the response is returned as a structured FHIR resource response with the content Base64-encoded and returned in the “data” element. The samples on this page represent that scenario. Alternatively, if one of those Accept header values is not specified, the raw content is returned directly using the associated content type, and the content type can be discerned from the Content-Type header of the response.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

Binary.Name: Binary
Binary.Description: A single instance of a FHIR Binary resource.

contentType.Name: contentType
contentType.Description: This is always "text/html" for labs data.

data.Name: data
data.Description: The note or document content, which is first converted to HTML and then returned as a base64-encoded string.

Data.Description:
Given a Binary FHIR ID, this web service returns an HTML or RTF version of the note or document content. Plain text notes are converted to HTML. The DocumentReference (Outside Record - Clinical Notes) (R4) resource can be used to obtain Binary FHIR IDs for notes.

When a read request is made for the Binary resource using an Accept header value of "application/fhir+xml" or "application/fhir+json", the response is returned as a structured FHIR resource response with the content Base64-encoded and returned in the “data” element. The samples on this page represent that scenario. Alternatively, if one of the two Accept header values is not specified, the raw content is returned directly using the associated content type and the content type can be discerned from the Content-Type header of the response.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients
Data.SampleResponse:
{"resourceType":"Binary",

"id":"eibaYRQF6yVTF.5R2n92hhMhIzS.lJx9doPV5HgjIawc3",

"contentType":"text/html",

"data":""}

contentType.Name: contentType
contentType.Description: This is always "text/html" for clinical notes.

data.Name: data
data.Description: The note or document content as a base64-encoded string.

Data.Description:
The Binary.Search interaction is intended only for Bulk FHIR clients. Other clients must use Binary.Read. This API supports only the _id parameter, so it acts similarly to a read.

Given a Binary FHIR ID, this web service returns an HTML or RTF version of the note or document content (plain text notes are converted to HTML). The DocumentReference (Outside Record — Clinical Notes) (R4) resource can be used to obtain a Binary FHIR ID for notes received through Payer Platform from outside organizations.

Data.Description:
The FHIR CarePlan resource is a broad container for summarizing the plan of treatment for a patient. It includes links to the Condition Resource (the patient's long term problem list) and the Goal Resource (the patient's longitudinal goals) as well as in-line detail about upcoming appointments and upcoming orders.

This resource is designed for inpatient-related care plan data.

This read interaction enables the lookup of a specific inpatient CarePlan resource by FHIR ID.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

ID.Name: ID
ID.Description: FHIR identifier for a CarePlan resource.

CarePlan.Name: CarePlan
CarePlan.Description: An instance of the R4 CarePlan resource.

activity.Name: activity
activity.Description: Actions to occur as part of the care plan.

activity-progress-notes-omitted.Name: extension
activity-progress-notes-omitted.Description: Error message indicating some notes were omitted from the progress element if it took more than a minute to load notes.

detail.Name: detail
detail.Description: A simple summary of a planned activity.

code.Name: code
code.Description: Detailed description of the type of planned activity.

description.Name: description
description.Description: This provides a textual description of constraints on the intended activity occurrence, including relation to other activities. It can also include objectives, pre-conditions and end-conditions. Finally, it can convey specifics about the activity such as body site, method, and route.

goal.Name: goal
goal.Description: Identifies goals that this activity is intended to contribute towards meeting. Reference to a Goal resource.

instantiatesUri.Name: instantiatesUri
instantiatesUri.Description: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan activity.

performer.Name: performer
performer.Description: Identifies who's expected to be involved in the activity. This is a display-only reference.

reasonReference.Name: reasonReference
reasonReference.Description: Reference to a Condition resource that justifies the inclusion of this activity as part of the care plan.

scheduledTiming.Name: scheduledTiming
scheduledTiming.Description: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Identifies what progress is being made for the specific activity.

statusReason.Name: statusReason
statusReason.Description: Reason for the current activity status.

outcomeReference.Name: outcomeReference
outcomeReference.Description: Reference to an Observation resource for linked flowsheet documentation.

progress.Name: progress
progress.Description: Notes about the progress of the activity.

addresses.Name: addresses
addresses.Description: The list of health issues this CarePlan addresses. Reference to a Condition resource or resources.

category.Name: category
category.Description: What "kind" of plan this is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing plans, such as "Home health", "psychiatric", "asthma", "disease management", or "wellness plan". SNOMED 736353004 should be used.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: The Encounter during which this CarePlan was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

goal.Name: goal
goal.Description: Reference to a Goal resource associated with this CarePlan.

intent.Name: intent
intent.Description: The level of authority/intentionality associated with the CarePlan.

period.Name: period
period.Description: Indicates when the plan came into effect and ended, or when it is intended to come into effect and end.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Whether the plan is currently being acted upon, represents future intentions, or is now a historical record.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient or subject of this care plan.

Data.Description:
The FHIR CarePlan resource is a broad container for summarizing the plan of treatment for a patient. It includes links to the Condition Resource (the patient's long term Problem List) and the Goal Resource (the patient's longitudinal goals) as well as in-line detail about upcoming appointments and upcoming orders.

This resource is designed for stating specific activities related to a single patient, rather than generic protocols for condition treatment. This is implemented as a patient-level resource, so a patient will always have exactly 1 longitudinal CarePlan, which contains the most up-to-date information regarding their care.

This read interaction enables the lookup of a specific longitudinal CarePlan resource by FHIR ID.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

ID.Name: ID
ID.Description: FHIR identifier for a CarePlan resource.

CarePlan.Name: CarePlan
CarePlan.Description: An instance of the R4 CarePlan resource.

activity.Name: activity
activity.Description: Actions to occur as part of the care plan. Activity resources can represent future appointments or orders.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
Order or procedure code. The SNOMED code is returned for order EAPs.
</br></br>
This element is only returned for activities with a detail kind of "ServiceRequest".

kind.Name: kind
kind.Description:
Always one of the following values:
  • Appointment: when this activity is a scheduled appointment
  • ServiceRequest: when this activity is an upcoming order.

scheduledPeriod.Name: scheduledPeriod
scheduledPeriod.Description: Appointment period (uses the linked appointment for orders).

status.Name: status
status.Description:
Appointment status or order request status.
Appointment status will always be one of the following values:
  • scheduled
  • completed
  • in-progress
  • cancelled
Order status will always be one of the following values:
  • not-started
  • scheduled
  • completed
  • cancelled
  • unknown

addresses.Name: addresses
addresses.Description: The list of health issues this longitudinal CarePlan addresses.

category.Name: category
category.Description:
Type of plan. 38717003 is always returned for longitudinal CarePlans.
In addition, category type "assess-plan" is always included in search results.

intent.Name: intent
intent.Description: For longitudinal CarePlans, this always equals "plan."

status.Name: status
status.Description: Always "active" for longitudinal CarePlans

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient or subject of this care plan.

text.Name: text
text.Description:
This element is available starting in the August 2021 version of Epic.

The patient's longitudinal CarePlan formatted as an XHTML fragment.

Data.Description:
The FHIR CarePlan resource is a broad container for summarizing the plan of treatment for a patient. This resource is designed to return specific activities related to a single patient, rather than generic protocols for condition treatment.

The CarePlan (Oncology) sub-resource returns episode-level CarePlan data, such as a patient’s treatment plans and therapy plans, and their cycles.

This read interaction enables the lookup of a specific oncology CarePlan resource by FHIR ID.

Data.Description:
The FHIR CarePlan resource is a broad container for summarizing the plan of treatment for a patient. It includes links to the Condition Resource (the patient's long term problem list) and the Goal Resource (the patient's longitudinal goals) as well as in-line detail about upcoming appointments and upcoming orders.

This resource is designed for inpatient-related care plan data.

The search interaction enables the lookup of one or more CarePlan resources, filtered by the specified parameters.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

activity-code.Description: Detailed description of the type of planned activity.

activity-date.Description: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

category.Name: category
category.Description: Type of plan.

condition.Name: condition
condition.Description: The list of health issues this CarePlan addresses. Reference to a Condition resource or resources.

date.Name: date
date.Description: Indicates when the plan came into effect and ended or when it is intended to come into effect and end.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: The Encounter during which this CarePlan was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

goal.Name: goal
goal.Description: Identifies goals that this activity is intended to contribute towards meeting. Reference to a Goal resource.

intent.Description: The level of authority/intentionality associated with the CarePlan.

patient.Description: Patient associated with the care plan.
patient.Optional: False

performer.Description: Unsupported

status.Description: Identifies what progress is being made for the specific activity.

Data.Description:
The FHIR CarePlan resource is a broad container for summarizing the plan of treatment for a patient. It includes links to the Condition Resource (the patient's long term Problem List) and the Goal Resource (the patient's longitudinal goals) as well as in-line detail about upcoming appointments and upcoming orders.

This resource is designed for stating specific activities related to a single patient, rather than generic protocols for condition treatment. This is implemented as a patient-level resource, so a patient will always have exactly 1 longitudinal CarePlan, which contains the most up-to-date information regarding their care.

The search interaction enables the lookup of one or more CarePlan resources, filtered by the specified parameters.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

category.Name: category
category.Description:
Type of plan. 38717003 should be used to search for longitudinal care plans.
In addition, category type "assess-plan" is always included in search results.

condition.Name: condition
condition.Description: The list of health issues this longitudinal care plan addresses.

date.Name: date
date.Description: Unsupported

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: Unsupported

goal.Description: Goals for this longitudinal care plan.

intent.Name: intent
intent.Description: For longitudinal care plans, this always equals "plan".

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: Patient FHIR resource ID for the patient associated with the care plan.
patient.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must match.

performer.Name: performer
performer.Description: Unsupported

status.Name: status
status.Description: Always "active."

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Patient FHIR resource ID for the patient associated with the care plan.
subject.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must match.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
Order or procedure code.
</br></br>
This element is only returned for activities with a detail kind of "ServiceRequest".

kind.Name: kind
kind.Description:
Always one of the following values:
  • Appointment: when this activity is a scheduled appointment
  • ServiceRequest: when this activity is an upcoming order.

scheduledPeriod.Name: scheduledPeriod
scheduledPeriod.Description: Appointment period (uses the linked appointment for orders).

status.Name: status
status.Description:
Appointment status or order request status.
Appointment status will always be one of the following values:
  • scheduled
  • completed
  • in-progress
Order status will always be one of the following values:
  • not-started
  • scheduled
  • completed
  • cancelled
  • unknown

addresses.Name: addresses
addresses.Description: The list of health issues this longitudinal care plan addresses.

category.Name: category
category.Description:
Type of plan. 38717003 should be used to search for longitudinal care plans.
In addition, category type "assess-plan" is always included in search results.

goal.Name: goal

intent.Description: For longitudinal care plans, this always equals "plan".

status.Description: Always "active."

subject.Description: The patient or subject of this care plan.

text.Name: text
text.Description:
This element is available starting in the August 2021 version of Epic.

The patient's longitudinal care plan formatted as an XHTML fragment.

Data.Description:
The FHIR CarePlan resource is a broad container for summarizing the plan of treatment for a patient. This resource is designed to return specific activities related to a single patient, rather than generic protocols for condition treatment.

The CarePlan (Oncology) sub-resource returns episode-level CarePlan data, such as a patient’s treatment plans and therapy plans, and their cycles.

This search interaction enables the lookup of one or more oncology CarePlan resources filtered by the specified parameters.

Data.Description:
Returns information about an episode’s care team.

The patient's inpatient treatment team and longitudinal care team are not included in this resource. Inpatient treatment team members are instead included as participants in the relevant Encounter resource. Longitudinal care team members are included in the CareTeam (Longitudinal CareTeam) (R4) API response.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

ID.Name: ID
ID.Description: FHIR ID for this CareTeam instance

ancillary-provider-poc-update.Name: extension
ancillary-provider-poc-update.Description: A string indicating whether each ancillary provider receives updates to the Plan of Care.

category.Name: category
category.Description: Always "Episode of care-focused care team".

name.Name: name
name.Description: The name of the care team.

participant.Name: participant
participant.Description:
A participant in the care team.

In scenarios where a provider on the care team has multiple specialties, this service returns one participant element for each unique combination of provider and specialty. For example, if a provider is listed on the care team twice, once with a specialty of "Radiology" and once with a specialty of "Behavioral Health", there will be two participant elements returned by this resource. They will have the same member reference but will have different roles.

member.Name: member
member.Description: Reference to a care team member

period.Name: period
period.Description: The start date and end date of the participant’s care team assignment.

participant-note.Name: extension
participant-note.Description: A string note that includes the number of visits with the participant each week and whether the participant receives Plan of Care updates.

period.Name: period
period.Description: The times the care team is active, from the earliest start date to the latest end date for any participant in the care team.

status.Name: status
status.Description: The status of the episode for which the care team is defined.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Patient identifier

Data.Description:
Returns information about a patient's care team and care team members. The patient's care team includes longitudinal care team assignments.

The patient's inpatient treatment team is not included in this resource. Inpatient treatment team members are instead included as participants in the relevant Encounter resource.

Data.Remarks:
This CareTeam API can return a Practitioner reference in the participant.member element to represent a provider who is part of the patient’s care team. If your application needs to access location and contact details for this provider, you can make a subsequent request to the PractitionerRole.Search API. In that request, set the practitioner search parameter equal to the Practitioner FHIR ID and use _include to include the related Location reference. For example:

https://hostname/instance/api/FHIR/R4/PractitionerRole?practitioner={Practitioner_FHIR_ID}&_include=PractitionerRole:location

category.Name: category
category.Description: Always "longitudinal".

participant.Name: participant
participant.Description:
A participant in the care team.

In scenarios where a provider on the care team has multiple specialties, this service will return one participant element for each unique combination of provider and specialty. For example if a provider is listed on the care team twice, once with a specialty of "Radiology" and once with a specialty of "Behavioral Health", there will be two participant elements returned by this resource. They will have the same member reference but will have different roles.

A participant can also be a RelatedPerson, which is typically an entity with a personal or professional relationship to the patient.

member.Name: member
member.Description: Reference to a care team member.

onBehalfOf.Name: onBehalfOf
onBehalfOf.Description:
Available starting in November 2021.

Reference to the last organization that updated an external care team member.

period.Name: period
period.Description: Time period.

role.Name: role
role.Description: Provider type or specialty, or related person type.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Always "active".

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Patient identifier.

Data.Description:
Returns information about an episode’s care team.

The patient's inpatient treatment team and longitudinal care team are not included in this resource. Inpatient treatment team members are instead included as participants in the relevant Encounter resource. Longitudinal care team members are included in the CareTeam (Longitudinal Care Team) (R4) API response.

This API currently supports only the _id search parameter. As a result, it functions similarly to CareTeam.Read (Episode Care Team) (R4).
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

category.Description: Type of team. Always "longitudinal."

date.Name: date
date.Description: Time period.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: Unsupported

participant.Name: participant
participant.Description: A participant in the care team.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: Patient FHIR resource ID.
patient.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided.

status.Name: status
status.Description: CareTeam status. The only supported value is "active".

subject.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided.

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: An array of entries included in this bundle.

resource.Name: resource
resource.Description: A container for a single FHIR resource.

category.Name: category
category.Description: Always "longitudinal".

participant.Name: participant
participant.Description:
A participant in the care team.

In scenarios where a provider on the care team has multiple specialties, this service will return one participant element for each unique combination of provider and specialty. For example if a provider is listed on the care team twice, once with a specialty of "Radiology" and once with a specialty of "Behavioral Health", there will be two participant elements returned by this resource. They will have the same member reference but will have different roles.

A participant can also be a RelatedPerson, which is typically an entity with a personal or professional relationship to the patient.

member.Name: member
member.Description: Reference to a care team member.

onBehalfOf.Name: onBehalfOf
onBehalfOf.Description:
Available starting in November 2021.

Reference to the last organization that updated an external care team member.

period.Name: period
period.Description: Time period.

role.Name: role
role.Description: Provider type or specialty, or related person type.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Always "active".

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Patient identifier.

Data.Description: This web service retrieves a single medical history problem or pertinent negative from a patient’s chart. You can query a problem noted in any encounter across the patient’s medical history. This resource can be queried using the FHIR ID of the patient’s medical problem.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients
Data.ChangeLog:
Epic Version Description Type
May 2023 (Special Updates to February 2023) Code systems in the Condition.category element now return a URL in place of an OID. Typical code systems include:

System URL OID
SNOMED http://snomed.info/sct 2.16.840.1.113883.6.96
LOINC http://loinc.org 2.16.840.1.113883.6.1
Breaking change

ID.Name: ID
ID.Description: FHIR identifier for the target Condition resource.

Condition.Name: Condition
Condition.Description: An instance of the R4 Condition resource.

category.Name: category
category.Description: Always “medical-history” for patient medical history.

code.Name: code
code.Description: Array of ICD codes and SNOMED concepts

note.Name: note
note.Description: The comment and display name for positive medical history, or the comment for pertinent negative medical history. Not shown in MyChart context.

onsetDateTime.Name: onsetDateTime
onsetDateTime.Description: The date when the medical problem began for the patient. Only applies to positive medical history.

onsetPeriod.Name: onsetPeriod
onsetPeriod.Description: The date range when the medical problem began for the patient. Only applies to positive medical history. Applicable for dates saved as fuzzy dates.

onsetString.Name: onsetString
onsetString.Description: The date when the medical problem began for the patient. Only applies to positive medical history. Applicable for dates saved as a string instead of a date format.

recordedDate.Name: recordedDate
recordedDate.Description: The date when the pertinent negative was noted on the patient’s chart. Only applies to pertinent negative medical history.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient ID

verificationStatus.Name: verificationStatus
verificationStatus.Description: Always “confirmed” for positive medical history and “refuted” for pertinent negative medical history.

Data.Description:
This web service retrieves a single problem from a patient's chart. This includes any data found in the patient's problem list across all encounters. This resource can be queried by a combination of patient ID and status.

A user or staff member accessing this FHIR resource must have security to have Problem List Item details included in the Condition resource.

Note that this resource retrieves only data stored in problem list (LPL) records. As a result, medical history data documented outside of a patient's problem list isn't available to applications using this service unless that data is retrieved using another method.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients
Data.ChangeLog:
Epic Version Description Type
May 2025 Previously data loss warnings in the conversion of notes were prepended to the note content (the note.text element in the FHIR resource). Now this warning is returned in a note.extension element. Breaking change
February 2024 The USCDIv3 specification for Condition will move the Condition's start date and time from onsetPeriod to onsetDatetime and end date and time from abatementPeriod to abatementDatetime fields. This could impact the evaluation of a Condition if a Condition consumer is not prepared for the transition. Breaking change
May 2023 (Special Updates to February 2023) Code systems in the Condition.category element now return a URL in place of an OID. Typical code systems include:

System URL OID
SNOMED http://snomed.info/sct 2.16.840.1.113883.6.96
LOINC http://loinc.org 2.16.840.1.113883.6.1
Breaking change
November 2022

Code systems in the Condition.code element for the following code sets now return a URL in place of an OID:
ActCode, ICD-10-CM, ICD-10-CA, ICD-10-NL, SNOMED

System URL OID
ActCode STU3: http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/ActCode

R4: http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ActCode		 2.16.840.1.113883.5.4
ICD-10-CM http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icd-10-cm 2.16.840.1.113883.6.90
ICD-10-CA http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icd-10-ca 2.16.840.1.113883.6.94
ICD-10-NL http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icd-10-nl 2.16.840.1.113883.6.3.2
SNOMED http://snomed.info/sct 2.16.840.1.113883.6.96
Breaking change

ID.Name: ID
ID.Description: FHIR identifier for the target Condition resource.

Condition.Name: Condition
Condition.Description: An instance of the R4 Condition resource.

abatementDateTime.Name: abatementDateTime
abatementDateTime.Description: Starting in the February 2024 version of Epic, if a condition has a resolved date, it appears here.

abatementPeriod.Name: abatementPeriod
abatementPeriod.Description: In the November 2023 version of Epic and earlier, the date the condition was resolved.

category.Name: category
category.Description:
Always includes category code "problem-list-item".

Can also include additional category codes, such as ‘sdoh,” based on diagnosis groupers defined by the Epic organization.

clinicalStatus.Name: clinicalStatus
clinicalStatus.Description: The clinical status, which can be active, resolved, or inactive. Starting in the February 2024 version of Epic, if the encounter diagnosis is linked to a problem, it uses the clinical status of the linked problem. This element is optional for encounter-level diagnoses.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
External codings for the condition. If a list of codes is sent, they're listed in this element. Otherwise, this element uses the problem name from the name element.

Starting in the February 2024 version of Epic or with special updates to November 2023, August 2023, or May 2023 version of Epic, each code also sends its display name and the provider-entered problem name is sent if available.

extension.Name: extension
extension.Description: Contains additional problem information, including references to associated SmartData elements.

note.Name: note
note.Description: Free text comments for the note. Can be an Overview note or, starting in the February 2025 version of Epic, an Assessment & Plan note.

annotationType.Name: extension
annotationType.Description:
This extension is returned starting in the following Epic versions, dependent on note type:

  • May 2025: Problem overview notes
  • February 2025: Assessment & Plan notes

Always contains a url of http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/annotationType and one of the following valueCodeableConcept LOINC codings:

  • Assessment & Plan notes: LOINC code 51847-2 (Evaluation + Plan note)
  • Problem overview notes: LOINC code 68608-9 (Summary note)

authorReference.Name: authorReference
authorReference.Description:
Who wrote the note.

This element is returned starting in the following Epic versions, dependent on note type:

  • May 2025: Problem overview notes
  • February 2025: Assessment & Plan notes

data-conversion-warning.Name: extension
data-conversion-warning.Description:
This extension is returned starting in the following Epic versions, dependent on note type:

  • May 2025: Problem overview notes
  • February 2025: Assessment & Plan notes

One or more of the following warnings can be returned depending on RTF to plan text conversion:

Reason for warning

Warning text

Formatting was lost due to unicode characters or tables being present in the original note.

Formatting of this note is different from the original.

The original note was RTF.

Formatting of this note might be different from the original.

There were one or more images in the original note.

Images from the original note were not included.

There were one or more media attachments in the original note.

Attached media from the original note were not included.

text.Name: text
text.Description:
The content of the note.

In the February 2025 version of Epic and earlier versions, this note text can include prepended data conversion warnings similar to those documented in the “extension (data-conversion-warning)” response element.

time.Name: time
time.Description:
The time that the note was signed.

This element is returned starting in the following Epic versions, dependent on note type:

  • May 2025: Problem overview notes
  • February 2025: Assessment & Plan notes

onsetDateTime.Name: onsetDateTime
onsetDateTime.Description: Starting in the February 2024 version of Epic, if a condition has a noted date, it appears here.

onsetPeriod.Name: onsetPeriod
onsetPeriod.Description: In the November 2023 and earlier versions of Epic, if a condition has a noted date, it appears here.

recordedDate.Name: recordedDate
recordedDate.Description: The date the condition was recorded.

recorder.Name: recorder
recorder.Description: Reference to the practitioner who updated the problem list.

stage.Name: stage
stage.Description: The stage or grade of the condition.

assessment.Name: assessment
assessment.Description: SmartData element associated with cancer staging for this condition.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient associated with the condition.

verificationStatus.Name: verificationStatus
verificationStatus.Description: If this is on the patient's local chart, the value is "confirmed". If it is outside data, it is "unconfirmed" or "provisional". Starting in the February 2024 version of Epic, if the encounter diagnosis is linked to a problem, it uses the verification status of the linked problem. This element is optional for encounter-level diagnoses.
verificationStatus.Optional: For organizations in the Netherlands, this value can be omitted for problems on the problem list.

Data.Description:
This web service retrieves problems from a patient's chart. This includes any data found in the patient's problem list across all encounters. This resource can be queried by a combination of patient ID and status.

Note that this resource retrieves only data stored in problem list records. As a result, medical history data documented outside of a patient's problem list isn't available to applications using this service unless that data is retrieved using another method.

This resource does not return unconfirmed Condition resources in the "holding tank" that drives the EpicCare Reconcile Outside Data Activity. Note - once a clinician reconciles a problem, a new Condition resource associated with the reconciled problem will be available in the normal Condition.Search results.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

Condition.Description: An instance of the R4 Condition resource.

abatementDateTime.Name: abatementDateTime
abatementDateTime.Description: Starting in the February 2024 version of Epic, the date the condition was resolved.

abatementPeriod.Name: abatementPeriod
abatementPeriod.Description: In the November 2023 and earlier versions of Epic, the date the condition was resolved.

assertedDateTime.Name: extension
assertedDateTime.Description: The date the condition was diagnosed.

category.Name: category
category.Description:
Always “problem-list-item” for this API.

Can also include additional category codes, such as “sdoh,” based on diagnosis groupers defined by the Epic organization.

clinicalStatus.Name: clinicalStatus
clinicalStatus.Description: The clinical status, which can be active, resolved, or inactive.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
External codings for the condition. If a list of codes is sent, they're listed in this element. Otherwise, this element uses the problem name from the name element.

Starting in the February 2024 version of Epic or with special updates to November 2023, August 2023, or May 2023 version of Epic, each code also sends its display name and the provider-entered problem name is sent if available.

note.Name: note
note.Description: Free text comments for the note. Can be an Overview note or, starting in the February 2025 version of Epic, an Assessment & Plan note.

annotationType.Name: extension
annotationType.Description:
This extension is returned starting in the following Epic versions, dependent on note type:

  • May 2025: Problem overview notes
  • February 2025: Assessment & Plan notes

Always contains a url of http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/annotationType and one of the following valueCodeableConcept LOINC codings:

  • Assessment & Plan notes: LOINC code 51847-2 (Evaluation + Plan note)
  • Problem overview notes: LOINC code 68608-9 (Summary note)

authorReference.Name: authorReference
authorReference.Description:
Who wrote the note. Returned only for Assessment & Plan type notes.a

Who wrote the note.

This element is returned starting in the following Epic versions, dependent on note type:

  • May 2025: Problem overview notes
  • February 2025: Assessment & Plan notes

data-conversion-warning.Name: extension
data-conversion-warning.Description:
This extension is returned starting in the following Epic versions, dependent on note type:

  • May 2025: Problem overview notes
  • February 2025: Assessment & Plan notes

One or more of the following warnings can be returned depending on RTF to plan text conversion:

Reason for warning

Warning text

Formatting was lost due to unicode characters or tables being present in the original note.

Formatting of this note is different from the original.

The original note was RTF.

Formatting of this note might be different from the original.

There were one or more images in the original note.

Images from the original note were not included.

There were one or more media attachments in the original note.

Attached media from the original note were not included.

text.Name: text
text.Description:
The content of the note.

In the February 2025 version of Epic and earlier versions, this note text can include prepended data conversion warnings similar to those documented in the “extension (data-conversion-warning)” response element.

time.Name: time
time.Description:
The time that the note was signed.

This element is returned starting in the following Epic versions, dependent on note type:

  • May 2025: Problem overview notes
  • February 2025: Assessment & Plan notes

onsetDateTime.Name: onsetDateTime
onsetDateTime.Description: Starting in the February 2024 version of Epic, if a condition has a noted date, it appears here.

onsetPeriod.Name: onsetPeriod
onsetPeriod.Description: In the November 2023 and earlier versions of Epic, if a condition has a noted date, it appears here.

recordedDate.Name: recordedDate
recordedDate.Description: The date the condition was recorded.

recorder.Name: recorder
recorder.Description: Reference to the practitioner who updated the problem list.

stage.Name: stage
stage.Description: The stage or grade of the condition.

assessment.Name: assessment
assessment.Description: SmartData element associated with cancer staging for this condition.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient associated with the condition.

verificationStatus.Name: verificationStatus
verificationStatus.Description: If this is on the patient's local chart, the value is "confirmed". If it is outside data, it is "unconfirmed". If it is deleted, it is "entered-in-error".
verificationStatus.Optional: For organizations in the Netherlands, this value can be omitted for problems on the problem list.

Data.Description:
The resource retrieves reasons for visit from a patient’s encounters. This includes any reason for visit information that was recorded in the patient’s chart by a clinician during any previous encounter.

This resource can be queried by a patient ID or an encounter ID.

Data.Description:
This resource can be used only with healthcare organizations in the Netherlands. This resource cannot be used in any other locales at this time.

The DiagnosticReport (Care Plan Goal) resource records the status of a patient in relation to a particular care plan goal.

The read interaction enables the look up of a DiagnosticReport resource by a constant server ID. Read interactions typically begin with a client having previously established a relationship, often through querying for diagnostic reports through the search interaction.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

Data.Description:
The DiagnosticReport resource represents a resulted, patient-related, non-medication order and data associated with the order and the patient.

This resource returns textual results and discrete result components. It can return lab, imaging, cardiology and endoscopy results. It can also return pathology results that are not a scan. Scans filed into Epic are not returned by this resource.

Starting in February 2024, DiagnosticReport can return EKG data using the Midmark third-party integration. If the EKG order collected heart rate and blood pressure data as well, this data is returned as Observations contained within the response.

Starting in May 2024, DiagnosticReport can return audiology exam finding data. Data within the audiology exam is returned as observations contained within the response.

The read interaction enables the look up of a DiagnosticReport resource by a constant server ID. The read interaction allows clients to store only the server ID, and with a single request, retrieve the most up-to-date result data on a patient. Read interactions typically begin with a client having previously established a relationship, often through querying for DiagnosticReports through the search interaction.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients
Data.Remarks:
Heart rate and blood pressure data associated with a Midmark result are represented as full Vital Signs Observations within the DiagnosticReport. Unlike other Observations associated with the order, these are contained resources, and are only accessible embedded within the DiagnosticReport. These resources are associated with the following LOINC codes:

  • Heart rate: 8867-4
  • Diastolic blood pressure: 8462-4
  • Systolic blood pressure: 8480-6

Data.Description:
This resource can be used only with healthcare organizations in the Netherlands. This resource cannot be used in any other locales at this time.

The DiagnosticReport (Care Plan Goal) resource records the status of a patient in relation to a particular care plan goal.

The Search interaction enables the client to query for all diagnostic reports that have been filed for a given patient. The client, having established the patient in question, now wishes to retrieve all care plan goal reports for the patient, and can further refine the search to specify a date or a LOINC code for the DiagnosticReport resources in question.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

DiagnosticReport.Name: DiagnosticReport
DiagnosticReport.Description: An instance of the R4 DiagnosticReport resource.

category.Name: category
category.Description: The service category. Always “outcome-of-care.”

code.Name: code
code.Description: The name/code for this diagnostic report. Hard coded to LOINC code 27574-3 for care plans.

issued.Name: issued
issued.Description: DateTime this version was released to providers.

result.Name: result
result.Description: Reference to the Observation (Actives of Daily Living) resource, which describes the observed state of the patient.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Hard coded to a value of “final.”

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The subject of the report.

Data.Description:
The DiagnosticReport FHIR resource represents resulted diagnostic orders and relevant data associated with the order and the patient. Supported diagnostic services include laboratory, radiology, and cardiology, audiology, and endoscopy. Within DiagnosticReport, the Observation FHIR resource returns individual components from laboratory tests and text-based content, such as narratives or impressions, from radiology and cardiology results. This resource returns textual results and discrete result components. It can return lab, imaging, and cardiology results. It can also return pathology results that are not a scan. Scans filed into Epic are not returned by this resource.

Starting in February 2024, DiagnosticReport can return EKG data using the Midmark third-party integration. If the EKG order collected heart rate and blood pressure data as well, this data is returned as Observations contained within the report.

Starting in May 2024, DiagnosticReport can return audiology exam finding data. Data within the audiology exam is returned as observations contained within the response.

The DiagnosticReport resource corresponds to the following Common Clinical Data Set (CCDS) Elements: Laboratory Tests.

The search interaction for DiagnosticReport enables the client to query for diagnostic reports based on a patient and additional optional parameters, such as date, LOINC code/Identity ID, or order ID/accession number. Client may use the Patient Identifier Web Service to establish an identifier for a patient.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients
Data.Remarks:
Text based result content, such as narratives, impressions, or addendums, will be represented as related Observations rather than in the text element inherited by DomainResource. If the results from a Search return medication orders, an error will be returned for those orders.

Heart rate and blood pressure data associated with a Midmark result are represented as full Vital Signs Observations within the DiagnosticReport. Unlike other Observations associated with the order, these are contained resources, and are only accessible embedded within the DiagnosticReport. These resources are associated with the following LOINC codes:

  • Heart rate: 8867-4
  • Diastolic blood pressure: 8462-4
  • Systolic blood pressure: 8480-6

category.Name: category
category.Description:
The service category.

  • This can be either an Epic order type or a value from the US Core valueset for DiagnosticReport.
  • In earlier versions, this must be a value from the US Core valueset for DiagnosticReport.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
The code for the report as a whole, as opposed to codes for the atomic results, which are the names on the observation resource referred to from the result.
  • This can be any code type associated with the procedures, including LOINC, CPT, SNOMED, or other code types mapped to a procedure in Epic.
  • This parameter is formatted with or without a system specified (code=[code] or code=[system]|[code]). If specifying a system, the corresponding code must be provided.

date.Name: date
date.Description: Clinically relevant time/time period for report. Matches to the effectiveDateTime response element.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description:
Encounter when the test was ordered.

This will be either a FHIR Encounter reference in the encounter.reference element, or an encounter CSN identifier in the encounter.identifier element.

patient.Name: patient

patient.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must reference the same patient.

performer.Name: performer
performer.Description: Participants in producing the report. This always includes one or more references to the Practitioner resource. This element can also include a reference to an Organization resource.

result.Name: result
result.Description: Observations, simple or complex nested groups.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The reference to a patient resource.
subject.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must reference the same patient.

Data.Description:
The FHIR DocumentReference resource is a generic resource that can be used to communicate many different types of documents. This implementation of DocumentReference is used to communicate clinical notes in accordance with the US Core Implementation Guide.

The read interaction enables the look up of a DocumentReference resource by a constant server ID. The read interaction allows clients to store only the server ID, and with a single request, retrieve the most up-to-date result data on a patient. Read interactions typically begin with a client having previously established a relationship, often through querying for DocumentReference through the search interaction.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

The note type.

Can be in the format:

Otherwise, can be mapped using a core set of the Epic-released category values to LOINC codes:

  • code="10164-2"
  • system="https://loinc.org/"

Data.Description:
The FHIR DocumentReference resource is a generic resource that can be used to communicate many different types of documents. This implementation of DocumentReference is used to communicate clinical notes in accordance with the US Core Implementation Guide.

The search interaction enables the client to query for clinical note (HNO) records based on a patient and optionally document type, status, encounter ID, note creation time, or associated encounter period.

A MyChart user accessing this FHIR resource must be authorized to view documents in MyChart.
