author.Name: author
author.Description: Who or what authored the document.

category.Name: category
category.Description: Should always be "clinical-note" if specified.
category.Optional: Either category or type is required to search clinical notes

custodian.Name: custodian
custodian.Description: The display name for the current organization.

date.Name: date
date.Description: When the document reference was created.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: The encounter that holds the DocumentReference data.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: The Patient FHIR ID for whom the clinical note was written.
patient.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must reference the same patient.

period.Name: period
period.Description: When the service was documented (FHIR Date and Time Parameters).

related.Name: related
related.Description: A reference to the Observation FHIR resource that contains the SmartData element.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Always returns "current".

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The Patient FHIR ID for whom the clinical note was written.
subject.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must reference the same patient.

type.Name: type
type.Description:
The note category ID or the LOINC code for the document type.

  • code= By default, we support the following LOINC codes for document type. Epic organizations can support additional LOINC codes beyond these defaults with custom mapping.
    • Discharge Documentation (18842-5)
    • Consultation (11488-4)
    • History & Physical (34117-2)
    • Progress Note (11506-3)
    • Procedure Note (28570-0)
    • Emergency Department Note (34111-5)
    • Nurse Note (34746-8)

Starting in the May 2022 version of Epic or the February 2022 version of Epic by special update:

    • Discharge Instructions (74213-0)
    • Risk assessment and screening note (75492-9)

Note category IDs can also be specified, and correspond to note types in Epic.
The format for using Note category IDs is:
type=system|code, where:
system="1.2.840.114350.1.13.[environment identifier].[environment_type].7.4.737880.5010"
code=the note category ID
"environment identifier" is different per epic instance and should be determined at time of implementation. For the App Orchard sandbox it is '0'
"environment type" is '2' for a production instance, '3' for a non-production instance, and '1' for the App Orchard sandbox. For example, in the App Orchard sandbox, if searching for Progress Notes:
type=1.2.840.114350.1.13.0.1.7.4.737880.5010|1
type.Optional: Either category or type is required to search clinical notes

clinical-note-pre-procedure-diagnosis.Description: The diagnosis associated with a clinical note prior to a related procedure.

related.Description: A reference to the Observation FHIR resource that contains the SmartData element.

custodian.Name: custodian
custodian.Description: The display name for the current organization.

date.Description: When this document reference was created.

extension-DocumentReference.attester.Name: extension
extension-DocumentReference.attester.Description: The authenticators of a document. An extension is returned for each authenticator.

mode.Name: extension
mode.Description:
The role of a note authenticator:

  • Signer
  • Cosigner
  • Attesting Cosigner
  • Transcription Authenticator

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: The note identifier from the Epic system.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Always returns "current".

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient that is the subject of the note.

type.Name: type
type.Description:
The note type.

Can be in the format:

  • code= Note Type value from category list
  • system=customer-specific oid for category list

For example: "urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.0.1.7.4.737880.5010"

Otherwise, can be mapped using a core set of the Epic-released category values to LOINC codes:

  • code="10164-2"
  • system="https://loinc.org/"

account.Description: The hospital account associated with an encounter. Includes an identifier for the hospital account, not a full reference to a FHIR Account resource.

class.Description:
Classification of patient encounter.
For organizations in the Netherlands, this element includes only the ACT encounter code, following the same logic used for Care Everywhere encounter CDA documents.
This element is available starting in the November 2021 version of Epic.

diagnosis.Name: diagnosis
diagnosis.Description:
Reference to the Condition (Problem) resource. Returns the principal problem for the hospital encounter. Used only for hospital encounters.
This element is available starting in the November 2021 version of Epic.

episodeOfCare.Name: episodeOfCare
episodeOfCare.Description: The episode associated with the encounter.

hospitalization.Name: hospitalization
hospitalization.Description: Details about the admission to a healthcare service.

destination.Name: destination
destination.Description: Location to which the patient is discharged. Reference to a Location resource.

dischargeDisposition.Name: dischargeDisposition
dischargeDisposition.Description:
Category or kind of location after discharge. This element returns dispositions from external concept mapping for organizations in the Netherlands.
This element is available starting in the November 2021 version of Epic.

ip-admit-datetime.Name: extension
ip-admit-datetime.Description: The Universal Time (UTC) date and time the patient was admitted as inpatient. This extension is available starting in the February 2023 version of Epic or in November 2022, May 2022, and February 2022 by SU.

observation-datetime.Name: extension
observation-datetime.Description: The Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) date and time the patient was admitted for observation. This extension is available starting in the February 2023 version of Epic or in November 2022, May 2022, and February 2022 by SU.

origin.Name: origin
origin.Description: The location from which the patient came before admission.

reAdmission.Name: reAdmission
reAdmission.Description: The type of hospital re-admission that has occurred (if any). If the value is absent, then this is not identified as a readmission.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: The unique identifier(s) for the encounter.

ip-admit-datetime.Name: extension
ip-admit-datetime.Description: The Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) date and time the patient was admitted as inpatient. This extension is available starting in the February 2023 version of Epic or in November 2022 and May 2022 by SU.

is-scannable-encounter.Name: extension
is-scannable-encounter.Description: If true, this encounter is scannable.

location.Name: location
location.Description: Can return a department, location, hospital room, or bed. Department and location are determined dynamically depending on a variety of factors.

location.Name: location
location.Description: Location the encounter takes place. Reference to a Location resource.

period.Name: period
period.Description: Time period during which the patient was present at the location.

observation-datetime.Name: extension
observation-datetime.Description: The Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) date and time the patient was admitted for observation. This extension is available starting in the February 2023 version of Epic or in November 2022 and May 2022 by SU.

participant.Name: participant
participant.Description: List of participants involved in the encounter. This can include but is not limited to: attending provider, referring provider, interpreters, and appointment providers.

individual.Name: individual
individual.Description: Reference to the Practitioner resource representing the participant.

period.Name: period
period.Description: Period of time during the encounter that the participant participated. No period is populated for admitting and referring providers.

specialty.Name: extension
specialty.Description: Specialty of the participant in the encounter.

team-name.Name: extension
team-name.Description: Team name of the participant in the encounter.

type.Name: type
type.Description: Role of participant in encounter. This element is set to ADM for admitting provider, ATND for attending provider, PART for ambulatory participants, REF for referring provider, translator for interpreters, or OTTM for other treatment team members.

partOf.Name: partOf
partOf.Description: Another Encounter this encounter is part of. Reference to an Encounter resource.

period.Name: period
period.Description: The start and end time of the encounter.

priority.Name: priority
priority.Description: Indicates the urgency of the encounter.

reasonCode.Name: reasonCode
reasonCode.Description: The reason for visit. The reason parameter may not always be populated. Unlike the Condition resource which documents diagnoses such as the flu, the reason parameter corresponds to the reason a patient gave for having that encounter such as a fever.

serviceProvider.Name: serviceProvider
serviceProvider.Description: Reference to the Organization resource representing the service area for the encounter based on facility hierarchy. Returned starting in the February 2025 version of Epic (back to May 2024 version with Special Update).

serviceType.Name: serviceType
serviceType.Description: Type of service associated with this encounter.

status.Name: status
status.Description: The encounter status. Full list of statuses can be found here.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Reference to the Patient resource who was the subject of the encounter.

type.Name: type
type.Description: The encounter type.

Data.Description:
The Encounter (Patient Chart) resource defines the setting where patient care takes place. This includes ambulatory, inpatient, emergency, home health, and virtual encounters.

This web service will return all inpatient encounters in the specified time period, but will only return outpatient encounters once they have been checked in.

You can't use the Encounter (Patient Chart) resource to find upcoming appointments. Instead, use the Appointment resource to retrieve information on upcoming appointments.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients
Data.Remarks:
You shouldn't use the Encounter resource to store upcoming appointment information. Use the Appointment resource instead. Encounter IDs are not valid until the encounter has started.

Starting in the November 2021 version of Epic, the _revInclude parameter can be used to include AuditEventinformation with this resource, which indicates the history of modifications to a patient’s encounter care team.

This element is available starting in the November 2021 version of Epic.

ip-admit-datetime.Name: extension
ip-admit-datetime.Description: The Universal Time (UTC) date and time the patient was admitted as inpatient. This extension is available starting in the February 2023 version of Epic or in November 2022, May 2022, and February 2022 by SU.

observation-datetime.Name: extension
observation-datetime.Description: The Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) date and time the patient was admitted for observation. This extension is available starting in the February 2023 version of Epic or in November 2022, May 2022, and February 2022 by SU.

origin.Name: origin
origin.Description: The location from which the patient came before admission.

reAdmission.Name: reAdmission
reAdmission.Description: The type of hospital re-admission that has occurred (if any). If the value is absent, then this is not identified as a readmission.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: The unique identifier(s) for the encounter.

ip-admit-datetime.Name: extension
ip-admit-datetime.Description: The Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) date and time the patient was admitted as inpatient. This extension is available starting in the February 2023 version of Epic or in November 2022 and May 2022 by SU.

is-scannable-encounter.Name: extension
is-scannable-encounter.Description: If true, this encounter is scannable.

location.Name: location
location.Description: Can return a department, location, hospital room, or bed. Department and location are determined dynamically depending on a variety of factors.

period.Name: period
period.Description: Time period during which the patient was present at the location.

observation-datetime.Name: extension
observation-datetime.Description: The Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) date and time the patient was admitted for observation. This extension is available starting in the February 2023 version of Epic or in November 2022 and May 2022 by SU.

participant.Name: participant
participant.Description: List of participants involved in the encounter. This can include but is not limited to: attending provider, referring provider, interpreters, and appointment providers.

individual.Name: individual
individual.Description: Reference to the Practitioner resource representing the participant.

period.Name: period
period.Description: Period of time during the encounter that the participant participated. No period is populated for admitting and referring providers. Populated for appointment providers starting in November 2022 version of Epic.

specialty.Name: extension
specialty.Description: Specialty of the participant in the encounter.

team-name.Name: extension
team-name.Description: Team name of the participant in the encounter.

type.Name: type
type.Description: Role of participant in encounter. This element is set to ADM for admitting provider, ATND for attending provider, PART for ambulatory participants, REF for referring provider, translator for interpreters, or OTTM for other treatment team members.

partOf.Name: partOf
partOf.Description: Another Encounter this encounter is part of. Reference to an Encounter resource.

period.Name: period
period.Description: The start and end time of the encounter.

priority.Name: priority
priority.Description: Indicates the urgency of the encounter.

reasonCode.Name: reasonCode
reasonCode.Description: The reason for visit. The reason parameter may not always be populated. Unlike the Condition resource which documents diagnoses such as the flu, the reason parameter corresponds to the reason a patient gave for having that encounter such as a fever.

serviceProvider.Name: serviceProvider
serviceProvider.Description: Reference to the Organization resource representing the service area for the encounter based on facility hierarchy. Returned starting in the February 2025 version of Epic (back to May 2024 version with Special Update).

serviceType.Name: serviceType
serviceType.Description: Type of service associated with this encounter.

status.Name: status
status.Description: The encounter status. Full list of statuses can be found here.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Reference to the Patient resource who was the subject of the encounter.

type.Name: type
type.Description: The encounter type.

Data.Description: The FamilyMemberHistory resource defines a family member in a patient’s family history. It corresponds with demographic data about the family member as well as any medical conditions documented for that family member.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

ID.Name: ID
ID.Description: FHIR ID for this FamilyMemberHistory instance

bornPeriod.Name: bornPeriod
bornPeriod.Description: Range of dates between which family member was born

condition.Name: condition
condition.Description: Condition that the related person had

code.Name: code
code.Description: Condition that the related person had

note.Name: note
note.Description: Comment on a single condition

onsetAge.Name: onsetAge
onsetAge.Description: How old the family member was at the time of condition onset

onsetRange.Name: onsetRange
onsetRange.Description: How old the family member was at the time of condition onset and how old they were when it ended.

dataAbsentReason.Name: dataAbsentReason
dataAbsentReason.Description: Reason a family member history may not exist, such as "unable-to-obtain".

date.Name: date
date.Description: When history was recorded or last updated

deceasedBoolean.Name: deceasedBoolean
deceasedBoolean.Description: Whether or not the family member is deceased

id.Name: id
id.Description: FHIR ID for this FamilyMemberHistory instance

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: Unique ID for the family member history

note.Name: note
note.Description: General note about related person

relationship.Name: relationship
relationship.Description: Relationship to the patient, or "FAMMEMB" if the relationship is not clear.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Completion status for family member's history. Either "health-unknown" or "completed".

Data.Description:
The List (Allergies) API is used to represent the current allergies in a patient’s Allergy list in their chart.

Details about each allergy can be found with a subsequent Read request to the AllergyIntolerance resource.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

List.Name: List
List.Description: An instance of the R4 List FHIR resource.

code.Name: code
code.Description: The code representing the type of list searched. Always "allergies".

emptyReason.Name: emptyReason
emptyReason.Description: If the patient has no allergies documented, the API returns an empty reason of “notstarted”.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: A single entry in the list.

deleted.Name: deleted
deleted.Description: Code representing whether the allergy is deleted.

item.Name: item
item.Description: List of FHIR IDs returned by the AllergyIntolerance resource search, excluding external allergies.

id.Name: id
id.Description: FHIR identifier for this List resource instance.

mode.Name: mode
mode.Description: The processing mode that applies to this list. Always "working".

status.Name: status
status.Description: Status of the medication list. Always "current" because each list represents only the patient’s current allergies.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Reference to the Patient resource with whom the List is associated.

title.Name: title
title.Description: The title representing this entity. Always “Allergy List”.

Data.Description: The List (Family History) API defines the list family members that have been documented in a patient’s family history, as well as patient-level information that is documented alongside the family history, including adoptive parents, fertility status, and notes about the family history as a whole, referred to as pedigree annotations. Each family member is returned as a FamilyMemberHistory resource.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

List.Name: List
List.Description: An instance of the R4 List FHIR resource.

code.Name: code
code.Description: Code “pedigree-list” in Epic’s “/list-type” definition

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: FamilyMemberHistory references for patient’s family history.

id.Name: id
id.Description: FHIR identifier for this List resource instance.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Always "current"

title.Name: title
title.Description: Always "Pedigree List"

Data.Description:
The List (Hospital Problem) API is used to represent the list of problems addressed during the associated hospital encounter.

It includes problems that are currently marked as hospital problems for that encounter, and it also includes problems that were previously marked as hospital problems for that encounter but that are no longer marked as such. Each entry includes a reference to the Condition (Problem List) resource instance for the problem, details about whether the problem is currently marked as a hospital problem, details about whether the problem is the principal problem for the encounter, and the problem’s present on admission status.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

List.Name: List
List.Description: An instance of the R4 List FHIR resource.

code.Name: code
code.Description: Code “hospital-problem” in Epic’s “/list-type” definition.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: The encounter that this hospital problem list is for

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: There is one entry for each hospital problem on the encounter’s hospital problem list.

deleted.Name: deleted
deleted.Description:
If true, this problem is no longer marked as a hospital problem for this encounter, but it had been previously.

This is omitted if the problem is currently marked as a hospital problem.

hospital-problem-present-on-admission.Name: extension
hospital-problem-present-on-admission.Description:
The Present on Admission status for this problem on this encounter.

Default values include:

  • Yes
  • No
  • Unknown
  • Clinically Undetermined
  • Exempt from POA reporting

Epic organizations may define additional custom values.

is-principal-hospital-problem.Name: extension
is-principal-hospital-problem.Description: If true, this problem is the principal problem for this hospital encounter.

item.Name: item
item.Description: Reference to the Condition (Problem List Item) resource for this problem list item. The display name is set to the display name of the problem’s diagnosis.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Always “current”

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient that this hospital problem list is for.

title.Name: title
title.Description: Always “Hospital Problem List”

Data.Description: The List (Immunizations) API returns the patient’s documented immunizations as an immunization list. An immunization is documented when a vaccine is administered to the patient.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

List.Name: List
List.Description: An instance of the R4 List FHIR resource.

code.Name: code
code.Description: The code representing the type of list searched. Always "immunizations".

emptyReason.Name: emptyReason
emptyReason.Description: The reason why the list is empty. Always “notstarted” if populated.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: Each entry will be a BackboneElement with the "item" property populated with a reference to the Immunization.

id.Name: id
id.Description: FHIR identifier for this List resource instance.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Always "current"

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Reference to the patient resource with whom the List is associated.

title.Name: title
title.Description: The descriptive name for the list. Always “Immunization List”.

Data.Description:
The List (Medication) resource is used to represent the changes made to a patient’s home medications during a given encounter.

The medications in the list are categorized based on when the patient was supposed to be taking them relative to that encounter. For example, some medications might be flagged as medications that the patient was taking prior to the admission and others might be flagged as medications the patient should take after being discharged.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

List.Name: List
List.Description: An instance of the R4 List FHIR resource.

code.Name: code
code.Description: The code representing the type of list searched. Always "medications".

emptyReason.Name: emptyReason
emptyReason.Description: The reason why the list is empty. Only populated when the list is empty, and preferred to be one of the values here.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: Reference to the Encounter resource with which the List is associated.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: Each entry will be a BackboneElement with the "item" property populated with a reference to the MedicationRequest resource, and the "flag" property populated with a code representing how the medication relates to the encounter. These values are defined as an Epic-released structureDefinition.

flag.Name: flag
flag.Description:
Code representing how the medication relates to the encounter:

  • Stopped-in-visit
  • Unchanged
  • Prior-to-admission
  • Active-at-the-end-of-visit

item.Name: item
item.Description: Populated with a reference to the MedicationRequest resource for the represented order.

mode.Name: mode
mode.Description: The processing mode that applies to this list. Always "changes". Values can be found here.

note.Name: note
note.Description: If the list has a comment attached to it, that will be included here (including the most recent text of the comment, who last updated it, and when it was last updated). If list couldn't be loaded and we have an error message explaining why, that will be included here as well.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Status of the medication list. Always "retired" because each list only represents an encounter's changes. Values can be found here.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Reference to the Patient resource with whom the List is associated.

List.Name: List
List.Description: An instance of the R4 List FHIR resource.

code.Name: code
code.Description: Always "patients".

date.Description: dateTime that the request was made.

Data.Description: The List (Problem List) resource is used to represent a list of the patient’s current problems and conditions.

title.Name: title
title.Description: The title representing this entity. Always “Problem List”.

Data.Description:
The List (Allergies) API is used to represent the current allergies in a patient’s Allergy list in their chart.

This API can also be used to review the history of the patient’s allergy list by including AuditEvent data using the _revInclude parameter. To obtain more details about a specific allergy included in the patient’s allergy list, the AllergyIntolerance resource can be used.

Data.Description:
The List (Medication List) resource is used to represent the changes made to a patient’s home medications during a given encounter.

The medications in the list are categorized based on when the patient was supposed to be taking them relative to that encounter. For example, some medications might be flagged as medications that the patient was taking prior to the admission and others might be flagged as medications the patient should take after being discharged.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

code.Name: code
code.Description: The code representing the type of list to search. Must be "medications".
code.Optional: When _id is specified, Code is optional.

date.Name: date
date.Description: Unsupported

empty-reason.Name: empty-reason
empty-reason.Description:
The reason why the list is empty. Only populated when the list is empty, and preferred to be one of the values here.
  • Will be "nilknown" when the med list has been marked as reviewed for the encounter.
  • Will be "notasked" for all other encounters.
  • Will be "withheld" when in a MyChart context and all meds have been filtered.
  • Will be "unavailable" when we recorded a message in the "note" property above and quit before searching for meds.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: Reference to the Encounter resource with which the List is associated.
encounter.Optional: Required when the Subject, Patient, and _id parameters are empty.

item.Name: item
item.Description: Populated with a reference to the MedicationRequest resource for the represented order.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: The Patient resource with whom the List is associated.
patient.Optional: Required when the Encounter,Subject, and _id parameters are empty.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Status of the medication list. Always "retired" because each list only represents an encounter's changes. Values can be found here.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Reference to the Patient resource with whom the List is associated.
subject.Optional: Required when the Encounter, Patient, and _id parameters are empty.

title.Name: title
title.Description: Unsupported

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: Each entry will be a BackboneElement with the "item" property populated with a reference to the MedicationRequest resource, and the "flag" property populated with a code representing how the medication relates to the encounter. These values are defined as an Epic-released structureDefinition.

resource.Name: resource
resource.Description: A container for a single FHIR resource.

List.Name: List
List.Description: An instance of the R4 List FHIR resource.

code.Name: code
code.Description: The code representing the type of list searched. Always "medications".

emptyReason.Name: emptyReason
emptyReason.Description:
The reason why the list is empty. Only populated when the list is empty, and preferred to be one of the values here.
  • Will be "nilknown" when the med list has been marked as reviewed for the encounter.
  • Will be "notasked" for all other encounters.
  • Will be "withheld" when in a MyChart context and all meds have been filtered.
  • Will be "unavailable" when we recorded a message in the "note" property above and quit before searching for meds.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: Reference to the Encounter resource with which the List is associated.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: Each entry will be a BackboneElement with the "item" property populated with a reference to the MedicationRequest resource, and the "flag" property populated with a code representing how the medication relates to the encounter. These values are defined as an Epic-released structureDefinition.

flag.Name: flag
flag.Description:
Code representing how the medication relates to the encounter:

  • Stopped-in-visit
  • Unchanged
  • Prior-to-admission
  • Active-at-the-end-of-visit

item.Name: item
item.Description: Populated with a reference to the MedicationRequest resource for the represented order.

id.Name: id
id.Description: FHIR identifier for this List resource instance.

mode.Name: mode
mode.Description: The processing mode that applies to this list. Always "changes". Values can be found here.

note.Name: note
note.Description: If the list has a comment attached to it, that will be included here (including the most recent text of the comment, who last updated it, and when it was last updated). If list couldn't be loaded and we have an error message explaining why, that will be included here as well.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Status of the medication list. Always "retired" because each list only represents an encounter's changes. Values can be found here.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Reference to the Patient resource with whom the List is associated.

total.Name: total
total.Description: Total number of resources that matched the search criteria.

Data.Description: The FHIR List resource defines a collection of records that can be used within many places. Epic supports direct reading of the List resource to give access to Patient Lists, which includes My Lists and System Lists. To pull a My List, it must be the My List of the user whom the API call is made on behalf of or shared with that user.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

Data.Description:
The List (Problem List) API is used to represent a list of the patient’s current problems and conditions.

This resource is commonly used to review the history of the patient’s problems and conditions with AuditEvent. For more details about a specific problem or condition, you can use the Condition.Read (Problems) (R4) web service.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients
Data.Remarks:
AuditEvent

The following details are returned as part of the AuditEvent structure if AuditEvent data is included with this resource. For more information about AuditEvent, refer to the FHIR Search Parameters article in the Documentation section of this site.

Name

Description

Is Optional

Is Array

type (Coding)

Defines the audit event type. Always “Review History”.

true

false

recorded (Instant)

The instant that the user reviewed the patient’s problem list.

false

false

agent (Backbone)

Describes the user who reviewed the patient’s problem list.  

 

 

agent.requestor (Boolean)

Always “true”.

true

false

agent.who (Reference)

The user requesting the information.

false

false

agent.role (Coding)

Defines the agent role. Always “Reviewer”.

 

 

source (Backbone)

The user who reviewed the patient’s problem list.

 

 

source.observer (Reference)

The user requesting the information.

true

false

entity (Backbone)

Describes the problem list.

 

 

entity.what (Reference)

The List

true

false

date.Description: Unsupported

patient.Optional: Either patient or subject must be specified.

status.Description: Status of the problem list. Always "current" because each list represents only the patient’s current problems.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The Patient resource with which the List is associated.
subject.Optional: Either patient or subject must be specified.

title.Description: The title representing this entity. Always “Problem List”.

Data.Description:
The FHIR Medication resource defines detailed information about a medication order's product or package. The Medication resource is not specific to any patient.

The R4 Medication.Search interaction currently supports only the _id search parameter, making it similar to a Medication.Read request.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: An array of entries included in this bundle.

resource.Name: resource
resource.Description: A container for a single FHIR resource.

Medication.Name: Medication
Medication.Description: An instance of the R4 Medication FHIR resource.

code.Name: code
code.Description: Codes that identify this medication.

form.Name: form
form.Description: This is the form a dose can take, such as tablets or powder.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: A unique identifier for the medication record. This element is populated starting in the February 2023 version of Epic, the November 2022 version of Epic with special update E10304686, the May 2022 version of Epic with special update E10222715, and the February 2022 version of Epic with special update E10120851.

itemCodeableConcept.Name: itemCodeableConcept
itemCodeableConcept.Description: This element is used only with mixture components or single ingredient, non-mixture medications.

itemReference.Name: itemReference
itemReference.Description: This element is used only with mixture medications. It is a reference to a substance or medication.

display.Name: display
display.Description: The short name of the ingredient medication might appear with or without strength. Otherwise, the record name appears.

strength.Name: strength
strength.Description: The amount of each chemical present in a medication. Each chemical’s strength is returned individually. If no chemical information is available and it is a single-ingredient medication, the quantity of the ingredient present in the medication.

contained.Name: contained
contained.Description: A container for a single FHIR resource.

text.Name: text
text.Description: The order display name of the medication, otherwise the record name.

Data.Description:
The read interaction enables the look up of a MedicationDispense resource by a constant server ID.

This resource returns a medication’s fill status, as well as other information about the medication, such as the dose, route, and dispense quantity. This resource can return various types of medications, including prescriptions, inpatient-ordered medications, To Take Out (TTO) orders, and clinic-administered medications (CAMS) dispensed through Epic.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

MedicationDispense.Name: MedicationDispense
MedicationDispense.Description: A single instance of a MedicationDispense resource.

authorizingPrescription.Name: authorizingPrescription
authorizingPrescription.Description: Reference to the MedicationRequest that triggered the dispense.

doseAndRate.Name: doseAndRate
doseAndRate.Description: Information about the ranges and quantities of doses and rates.

doseQuantity.Name: doseQuantity
doseQuantity.Description: Amount of medication per dose. The amount of therapeutic or other substance given at one administration event.

doseRange.Name: doseRange
doseRange.Description: The high and low values of a medication’s dose.

sequence.Name: sequence
sequence.Description: The order of the dosage instructions

performer.Name: performer
performer.Description: The organization where the medication was dispensed and the user who performed the dispense action if applicable.

actor.Name: actor
actor.Description: The organization where the medication was dispensed and the user who performed the dispense action if applicable.

quantity.Name: quantity
quantity.Description: Amount dispensed. Accounts for partial returns in non-mixtures.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
The status of the medication dispense. Can be any of the following:

  • in-progress
  • cancelled
  • completed
  • declined
  • unknown

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient receiving the dispensed medication.

type.Name: type
type.Description:
Type of dispense. Can be any of the following:

  • First Fill
  • Refill
  • Emergency Supply
  • First Fill – Part Fill
  • Refill – Part Fill

whenHandedOver.Name: whenHandedOver
whenHandedOver.Description: When the product was given out or mailed. This must be populated if the status is completed.

Data.Description:
The read interaction enables the look up of a MedicationDispense resource by a constant server ID.

This resource indicates how a medication product is to be or has been dispensed for a named person/patient. This resource records the pharmacist verification of medication dispenses, rather than the actual dispenses. Note that MedicationDispense (Verified Orders) functions only for organizations in the Netherlands.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

MedicationDispense.Name: MedicationDispense
MedicationDispense.Description: A single instance of a MedicationDispense resource.

authoredOn.Name: extension
authoredOn.Description: The date the medication was verified.

authorizingPrescription.Name: authorizingPrescription
authorizingPrescription.Description: Reference to the medication request that triggered the dispense.

category.Name: category
category.Description:
Type of medication dispense.

Hard-coded to SNOMED code 422037009.

context.Name: context
context.Description: Reference to the encounter associated with the dispense.

additionalInstruction.Name: additionalInstruction
additionalInstruction.Description:
The patient administration instructions for the prescriptionmedication.
For a multi-line sig, this is the same.

doseAndRate.Name: doseAndRate
doseAndRate.Description: Information about the ranges and quantities of doses and rates.

doseQuantity.Name: doseQuantity
doseQuantity.Description: Amount of medication per dose. The amount of therapeutic or other substance given at one administration event.

doseRange.Name: doseRange
doseRange.Description: Parses the upper and lower bounds of the dose from above.

rateQuantity.Name: rateQuantity
rateQuantity.Description: The discrete value of a medication’s rate of infusion.

rateRange.Name: rateRange
rateRange.Description: The high and low values of a medication’s rate of infusion.

repeat.Name: repeat
repeat.Description: Element indicating an event that occurs multiple times.

boundsPeriod.Name: boundsPeriod
boundsPeriod.Description: The start and end dates for the medication.

duration.Name: duration
duration.Description: The medication duration. If duration is expressed as a range, this element is populated with the minimum duration.

durationMax.Name: durationMax
durationMax.Description: If duration is expressed as a range, this element is populated with the maximum duration.

period.Name: period
period.Description: The period.

extension.Name: extension
extension.Description: The duration of a medication’s use.

medicationReference.Name: medicationReference
medicationReference.Description: The FHIR ID representation of the ordered medication.

performer.Name: performer
performer.Description: The organization where the medication was verified.

actor.Name: actor
actor.Description: The organization where the medication was verified.

periodOfUse.Name: extension
periodOfUse.Description: The start and end dates for the medication.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
The status of the medication dispense. Can be either:

  • Completed
  • Entered-in-error

stopType.Name: extension
stopType.Description: Indicates whether a medication is temporarily or permanently inactive.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Who the medication is being dispensed to.

usageDuration.Name: extension
usageDuration.Description: The duration of a medication’s use.

  • Completed
  • Entered-in-error

stopType.Name: extension
stopType.Description: Indicates whether a medication is temporarily or permanently inactive.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Who the medication is being dispensed to.

usageDuration.Name: extension
usageDuration.Description: The duration of a medication’s use.

Data.Description:
The Observation (Labs) resource returns component level data for lab results. Observation is not normally used on its own to access lab results, because it is limited to reading microbiology sensitivities (method level, isolate level, and sensitivity level), textual (narrative and impression) Observations, and certain imaging Observations (such as Midmark EKG results). Instead, a system queries the DiagnosticReport resource to identify all lab procedures performed for a patient. The DiagnosticReport results contain pointers to one or more Observation resources that contain the component results. If you are familiar with HL7v2, DiagnosticReport is analogous to an OBR segment, where Observation is like an OBX segment.

For example, consider a CBC (Complete Blood Count) test. The overall CBC test would be represented as a DiagnosticReport resource. The component results (white blood cell count, red blood cell count, hemoglobin, platelet count, etc.) would each be returned in independent Observation resources.

Most systems expect to receive a LOINC code identifying each component. An Observation resource will be returned for a component result even if a LOINC code is not found, however the Observation.code property will be empty.

Some labs, such as pathology or cytology, often file a PDF, or a link to a PDF or other document as the result. We do not currently support returning PDF content or other reference pointer content via FHIR, however the test will be discoverable via a DiagnosticReport search.

For microbiology labs, the DiagnosticReport resource represents the culture. It includes references to Observation for each isolate. The isolates may then either reference an Observation for each method, or, if there is no method provided by the lab system, then the isolate will reference Observations for each sensitivity result. If methods are provided by the lab, then the method Observations will reference the sensitivity results.

The two potential structures are outlined below.

Microbiology results without methods:

  1. Culture (DiagnosticReport)
    1. Isolate A (Observation)
      1. Sensitivity results for antibiotic W (Observation)
      2. Sensitivity results for antibiotic X (Observation)
    2. Isolate B (Observation)
      1. Sensitivity results for antibiotic W (Observation)
      2. Sensitivity results for antibiotic X (Observation)

Microbiology results with methods:

  1. Culture (DiagnosticReport)
    1. Isolate A (Observation)
      1. Method 1 (Observation)
        Sensitivity results for antibiotic W (Observation)
        b. Sensitivity results for antibiotic X (Observation)
      2. Method 2 (Observation)
        Sensitivity results for antibiotic W (Observation)
        b. Sensitivity results for antibiotic X (Observation)
    2. Isolate B (Observation)
      1. Method 1 (Observation)
        Sensitivity results for antibiotic W (Observation)
        b. Sensitivity results for antibiotic X (Observation)
      2. Method 2 (Observation)
        Sensitivity results for antibiotic W (Observation)
        b. Sensitivity results for antibiotic X (Observation)

The category element is populated with SNOMED codes. In November 2021 and later, these codes are based on a mapping from component records to external SNOMED codes. From August 2021 to May 2021, this applies only to Netherlands environments and these codes are based on the value in the Order Type item in Epic.  The following SNOMED codes are supported, and must be mapped in the External Mapping Utility:

  • 252275004-Hematology (Hematologie)
  • 275711006-Chemistry (Klinische chemie)
  • 68793005-Serology (Serologie/ immunologie)
  • 395124008-Virology (Virologie)
  • 314076009-Toxicology (Toxicologie)
  • 19851009-Microbiology (Microbiologie)
  • 405825005-Molecular genetics (Moleculaire genetica)

Starting in February 2024, this subresource can also draw from data components linked to Midmark EKG orders. The information in these orders is linked to discrete items on the order (or other associated) records, corresponding to concepts with LOINC codes. In these instances, the category of the Observation is associated with the “Imaging” category as well as the “Laboratory” category. The discrete elements are tied to the following LOINC codes:

  • PR interval- 8625-6
  • P Wave axis- 8626-4
  • QRS duration- 8633-0
  • QRS wave axis- 8632-2
  • QT interval- 8634-8
  • QTC interval- 8636-3
  • T wave axis- 8638-9
  • Diagnostic statements- 8601-7
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

Epic Version Description Type
November 2022

Code systems for the following code sets now return a URL in place of an OID:
ActCode, ICD-10-CM, ICD-10-CA, ICD-10-NL, SNOMED

System URL OID

R4: http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ActCode		 2.16.840.1.113883.5.4
ICD-10-CM http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icd-10-cm 2.16.840.1.113883.6.90
ICD-10-CA http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icd-10-ca 2.16.840.1.113883.6.94

Observation.Name: Observation
Observation.Description: An instance of the R4 Observation resource.

(Lab-e-signature) (Extension).Name: extension
(Lab-e-signature) (Extension).Description:
This element is returned only for components with signatures as a string.

The signatures on a component.

basedOn.Name: basedOn
basedOn.Description: The procedure or service this observation is associated with.

category.Name: category
category.Description:
The Observation type. Always "laboratory".

For organizations in the Netherlands only, includes a category entry for the result type, using the ResultTypeCodelist. Starting in February 2022 and in November 2021 with a special update, Netherlands-specific SNOMED code 49581000146104-Laboratory Test Finding (Finding) is also returned.

For Midmark and other imaging data, “imaging” is also returned automatically.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
Code of the Observation.

Observation Grouper Code Description
Component The component name
Method The procedure code
Isolate The isolate LOINC code
Narrative or Impression Set to "Narrative" or "Impression"
Addendum Set to "Addendum" or "Unsigned Addendum"
Sensitivity The antibiotic code

dataAbsentReason.Name: dataAbsentReason
dataAbsentReason.Description:
The reason why normally expected content of the data element is missing. Set to “unknown” for lab result components with no values. 
This element is available starting in the February 2022 version of Epic.

derivedFrom.Name: derivedFrom
derivedFrom.Description: The method or isolate level Observation FHIR ID.

effectiveDateTime.Name: effectiveDateTime
effectiveDateTime.Description:
The prioritized instant. This is the instant the results were last updated.

This element can't be modified by Observation.Update.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: The Encounter FHIR ID linked to the order.

hasMember.Name: hasMember
hasMember.Description:
Values include:

  • has-member
    • used for sensitivity-level observations
  • derived-from
    • used for isolate-level observations

interpretation.Name: interpretation
interpretation.Description: The level of abnormality. If the value isn't mapped we will just send the text value in the Codeable concept. Relevant for sensitivities.

method.Name: method
method.Description: SNOMED code mapped to procedure record in Epic.

note.Name: note
note.Description: Comments about the result.

performer.Name: performer
performer.Description: A reference to the resulting agency's director's Practitioner resource.

referenceRange.Name: referenceRange
referenceRange.Description: The reference range for the result, if applicable.

high.Name: high
high.Description: The high value of the reference range.

low.Name: low
low.Description: The low value of the reference range.

specimen.Name: specimen
specimen.Description: A reference to the Specimen resource. Available starting in November 2021 version of Epic.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
The status of the lab order.

For organizations in the Netherlands, this element can also include a TestResultStatus extension that indicates the test result status.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The Patient FHIR ID linked to the order.

valueCodeableConcept.Name: valueCodeableConcept
valueCodeableConcept.Description: This element is populated only if a SNOMED code is associated with the component.
valueCodeableConcept.Optional: A value[x] element is required, but only one type of value[x] element will appear in the response.

valueQuantity.Name: valueQuantity
valueQuantity.Description: The result value if the result is numeric and represents a quantity.
valueQuantity.Optional: A value[x] element is required, but only one type of value[x] element will appear in the response.

valueRange.Name: valueRange
valueRange.Description: This element is populated only if the result is structured numeric and the operator is "-".
valueRange.Optional: A value[x] element is required, but only one type of value[x] element will appear in the response.

valueRatio.Name: valueRatio
valueRatio.Description: This element is populated only if the result is structured numeric and the operator is ":".
valueRatio.Optional: A value[x] element is required, but only one type of value[x] element will appear in the response.

valueString.Name: valueString
valueString.Description: The result value if the result is a string.
valueString.Optional: A value[x] element is required, but only one type of value[x] element will appear in the response.

Data.Description: The FHIR Observation resource defines measurements and assertions about a patient, including LDA-W (lines, drains, airways, and wound) data.

Data.ChangeLog:
Epic Version Description Type

August 2025

(May 2025, February 2025, November 2024 by special update)

 Starting in August 2024, May 2025 with special update E11400862, February 2025 with special update E11306699, and November 2024 with special update E11211328, multi-select fields are handled separately, and if a SNOMED concept mapping exists for any individual selection, the SNOMED concept mapping is included in the FHIR response. Previously, when a user selected multiple options, the system treated the entire list as a single combined value.   Substantive Changes

ID.Name: ID
ID.Description: The read interaction uses the given Observation FHIR ID to retrieve the most up-to-date information about a LDA (details and properties) or a LDA assessment.

Observation.Name: Observation
Observation.Description: An instance of the R4 Observation resource.

category.Name: category
category.Description:
The category is always "LDA".

Starting in February 2022, this element also always returns a second category which clarifies the type of LDA data returned in the response:

  • The category “LDA-property” is used for LDA properties, which are documented only once. For example, a nurse might insert a line and document properties such as the insertion time, the body site, and the method of insertion.
  • The category “LDA-assessment” is used for LDA assessments, which are performed over time. For example, a nurse might inspect an inserted line regularly to make sure the site is clean or assess a wound to see if a new dressing should be applied.

This element can't be modified by Observation.Update.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
LOINC code, CADSR code, or encoded flowsheet ID. Either this element or category must be provided, but not both.

This element can't be modified by Observation.Update.

The code element value varies depending upon what is passed (for example, a flowsheet ID vs. a LOINC code). If using a flowsheet ID, the system value is different between Epic organizations, and it is also different between production and non-production environments for the same organization.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
LOINC code, CADSR code, or encoded flowsheet ID. Either this element or category must be provided, but not both.

This element can't be modified by Observation.Update.

The code element value varies depending upon what is passed (for example, a flowsheet ID vs. a LOINC code). If using a flowsheet ID, the system value is different between Epic organizations, and it is also different between production and non-production environments for the same organization.

interpretation.Name: interpretation
interpretation.Description:
Available starting in the February 2022 version of Epic.

Possible values include:

  • “Abnormal” for observation values outside the reference range or expected norm
  • “Significant” for observation values that a clinician has manually flagged for extra attention

LDA-Property-Comment.Name: extension
LDA-Property-Comment.Description: The comment associated with the LDA property observation value, if applicable.

valueCodeableConcept.Name: valueCodeableConcept
valueCodeableConcept.Description: This element is populated if the data type is category or custom list. Only one of the value* elements is required.

valueDateTime.Name: valueDateTime
valueDateTime.Description: This element is populated if the data type is category or custom list. Only one of the value* elements is required.

valueQuantity.Name: valueQuantity
valueQuantity.Description: This element is populated if a value has units or the data type is numeric or a percentile. Only one of the value* elements is required.

valueString.Name: valueString
valueString.Description: This element is populated if a value doesn't have units or the data type is string. Only one of the value* elements is required.

valueTime.Name: valueTime
valueTime.Description: This element is populated if the data type is time. Only one of the value* elements is required.

effectiveDateTime.Name: effectiveDateTime
effectiveDateTime.Description:
This is a required element for LDA assessment observations.

The date and time the LDA assessment was taken. This element can't be modified by Observation.Update.

effectivePeriod.Name: effectivePeriod
effectivePeriod.Description: Start instant and/or end instant of the LDA. This element is only returned with LDA properties.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description:
Reference to an encounter resource.

This element can't be modified by Observation.Update.

interpretation.Name: interpretation
interpretation.Description:
Available starting in the February 2022 version of Epic.

Possible values include:

  • “Abnormal” for observation values outside the reference range or expected norm
  • “Significant” for observation values that clinician has manually flagged for extra attention

issued.Name: issued
issued.Description:
This is a required element for LDA assessment observations.

The date and time the observation was documented. This is always the current time.

note.Name: note
note.Description: The comment associated with the LDA assessment observation value, if applicable.

performer.Name: performer
performer.Description:
This is a required element for LDA assessment observations.

The practitioner who filed the LDA assessment observation.

event-performerFunction.Name: extension
event-performerFunction.Description:
Available starting in the February 2022 version of Epic for LDA assessments.

Additional practitioners associated with the LDA assessment observation value, if applicable.

Possible values include:

  • “data entry person” for practitioners who transcribed the observation into the system
  • “verifier” for practitioners who cosigned the observation

sequelTo.Name: extension
sequelTo.Description:
This is a required element for LDA assessment observations.

sequelTo extension that is a reference to the parent LDA FHIR ID.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
The status of the observation.

The status is always "final" for LDA properties.

Starting in February 2022, possible values for LDA assessments include:

  • “final” if the data is filed at time of retrieval
  • “preliminary” if the data has not yet been filed at the time of retrieval
  • “amended” if the data has been modified at time of retrieval
  • “entered-in-error” if the data had once existed, but has since been withdrawn at time of retrieval

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description:
Reference to a patient resource.

This element can't be modified by Observation.Update.

supportingInfo.Name: extension
supportingInfo.Description:
Available starting in the February 2022 version of Epic for LDA assessments.

If an LDA assessment is linked to a note written by a clinician, this is a reference to the DocumentReference resource.

valueCodeableConcept.Name: valueCodeableConcept
valueCodeableConcept.Description: In LDA assessments, this element is populated if the data type is category or custom list. Only one of the value* elements is required.

valueDateTime.Name: valueDateTime
valueDateTime.Description: In LDA assessments, this element is populated if the data type is date. Only one of the value* elements is required.

valueQuantity.Name: valueQuantity
valueQuantity.Description: In LDA assessments, this element is populated if a value has units or the data type is numeric or a percentile. Only one of the value* elements is required.

valueString.Name: valueString
valueString.Description:
In LDA properties, this is a required element which returns the LDA display name.

In LDA assessments, this element is populated if a value doesn't have units or if the data type is string. For image rows, a comma-delimited list of external document identifiers is returned.

For assessments that include an image that does not have external document identifiers, "Images linked" is returned.

Only one of the value* elements is required.

valueTime.Name: valueTime
valueTime.Description: In LDA assessments, this element is populated if the data type is time. Only one of the value* elements is required.

Data.Description:
The FHIR Observation Social History resource retrieves one or more of the following details:

Type of data Description

Smoking history

The status of a patient's tobacco use. This could be used to determine if the patient is a current or former tobacco user, what type of tobacco product is/was used, and the dates the patient started and, if a former user, stopped using tobacco. This includes passive exposure information in the code response element.

Pregnancy Status

The patient's current pregnancy status.

Pregnancy Intention

The patient’s intentions of becoming pregnant in the next year. Available starting in the February 2024 version of Epic.

Lactation Status

The patient's current lactation status.

Physical Findings of Uterus

Whether the patient has a uterus.

Estimated Delivery Date

The patient's estimated date of delivery.

Last Menstrual Period

The patient's last menstrual period.

Alcohol use history

The patient's alcohol use history and, if applicable, the type and amount of alcohol the patient consumes.

Drug use history

The patient's drug use history and, if applicable, the type and amount of drugs the patient consumes.

Living situation

The patient's current living situation.

Socioeconomic History

The patient's demographic and employment information.

Social documentation

The social documentation notes stored in the patient's history.

Sexual Orientation

The patient's sexual orientation. Available starting in the May 2024 version of Epic.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

Data.ChangeLog:
Epic Version Description Type
February 2024 Updated the mappings for the “82810-3 Pregnancy Status” to return with SNOMED values more specific to Pregnancy Status. Be sure to update any functionality that relies on these codes. Also added the “86645-9 Pregnancy Intention” LOINC code which returns values for the patient’s willingness to become pregnant in the next year. Breaking Change
November 2022 Fixed a bug that caused the "32486-3 Physical Findings of Uterus" LOINC code return with a SNOMED system value (http://snomed.info/sct) instead of a LOINC system (http://loinc.org). If you use this LOINC code, make sure you aren't relying on seeing a SNOMED system. Breaking Change

Observation.Name: Observation
Observation.Description: An instance of the R4 Observation resource.

category.Name: category
category.Description: This is always "social-history".

code.Name: code
code.Description:
The following value(s), depending on the type of data returned:

  • Smoking history: LOINC code 72166-2 and SNOMED code 365980008.
  • Sexual Orientation: LOINC code 76690-7
  • Alcohol use history: LOINC code 11331-6 and SNOMED code 228273003
  • Drug use history: LOINC code 11343-1 and SNOMED code 228366006
  • Living situation: SNOMED code 365508006
  • Pregnancy status: LOINC code 82810-3
  • Pregnancy intention: LOINC code 86645-9
  • Lactation status: LOINC code 63895-7
  • Physical findings of uterus: LOINC code 32486-3
  • Estimated delivery date: LOINC code 11778-8
  • Menstrual status: LOINC code 3146-8
  • Last menstrual status: LOINC code 8665-2

component.Name: component
component.Description:
Applies only to smoking history, alcohol use history, drug use history, and socioeconomic (education and occupational) history.

Holds additional detail depending on the type of observation:

Smoking history: Can include one or more of the following code values, paired with either a valueCodeableConcept or a valueQuantity that include additional detail:

  • Tobacco product (LOINC 81228-9; SNOMED 53661000146106)
  • Cigarette pack-years (SNOMED 401201003)
  • Tobacco use duration (LOINC 88029-4)
  • Packs per day (LOINC 8663-7; SNOMED 266918002)

Alcohol use history: The amount of alcohol consumed per day (SNOMED 160573003), expressed in UCUM units as alcoholic_units/day.

Drug use history: Can include one or more of the following code values, paired with either a valueCodeableConcept or a valueString that include additional detail:

  • Type of substance (LOINC 63643-1; SNOMED 410942007)
  • Frequency of misuse (SNOMED 228390007)

Education: Can include the following code value, paired with either a valueCodeableConcept or valueString that includes additional detail:

  • The patient’s highest level of education (LOINC code 82589-3)

Occupational: Can include one or more of the following code values, paired with either a valueCodeableConcept or valueString that includes additional detail:

  • The patient’s occupation (LOINC code LP133724-7)
  • The patient’s employer (LOINC code 80427-8)
  • The patient’s occupation industry (LOINC code 86188-0)

dataAbsentReason.Name: dataAbsentReason
dataAbsentReason.Description: Populated if there is no last menstrual period start date but there is a last menstrual period start date comment or precision. Populated if there is no lactation status but there is a lactation status comment.

derivedFrom.Name: derivedFrom
derivedFrom.Description: References the corresponding menstrual status observation that the pregnancy status is derived from.

effectiveDateTime.Name: effectiveDateTime
effectiveDateTime.Description: The date of the encounter on which the obstetric observation was documented.
effectiveDateTime.Optional: Required if there is an encounter where obstetric status observations were documented.

issued.Name: issued
issued.Description:
The date when this status is documented. This is set to the date that the status was assessed, if available. Otherwise, this is set to one of the following values to indicate that the response is considered up-to-date as of the specified date:

  • The date of the patient's most recent history encounter, if available.
  • The current date.

The issued date may not be populated for every observation type

note.Name: note
note.Description:
The comments for smoking history, alcohol use history, drug use history, employment history, last menstrual period, or lactation status. If applicable, this appears within the last menstrual period or lactation status observations.

For organizations in the Netherlands, these are sent in both provider and MyChart contexts.

For all other organizations, These are sent only in a provider context.

performer.Name: performer
performer.Description: The person who documented the status. This is not populated if the status is never assessed.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
This value is always "final".

More detailed status information, such as whether the patient’s smoking status is unknown, can be found by reviewing the values specified in the code element or the valueCodeableConcept element.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient FHIR ID.

valueBoolean.Name: valueBoolean
valueBoolean.Description: Yes/No answer to whether the patient has a uterus.
valueBoolean.Optional: Used for physical findings of uterus.

valueCodeableConcept.Name: valueCodeableConcept
valueCodeableConcept.Description:
The SNOMED code or other value pertaining to smoking status, alcohol use status, drug use status, living situation, pregnancy status, lactation status, or pregnancy intention. Default Epic-to-SNOMED mappings are listed below. This value can also be modified by organization-specific mapping.

Smoking history supported values:

  • 449868002-Smokes tobacco daily (finding)
  • 428041000124106-Current some day smoker
  • 230059006-Occasional cigarette smoker (available in Netherlands environments only)
  • 77176002-Smoker, current status unknown
  • 8517006-Former smoker
  • 266919005-Never smoker
  • 43381005-Passive smoker (available in Netherlands environments only)
  • 266927001-Unknown if ever smoker
  • 266919005-Never smoker
  • 266927001-Unknown if ever smoker
  • 428071000124103-Heavy tobacco smoker
  • 428061000124105-Light tobacco smoker

Alcohol use history supported values:

  • 219006-Current drinker of alcohol (finding)
  • 105542008-Current non-drinker of alcohol (finding)
  • OTH-Other
  • 82581004-Ex-drinker (finding)
  • 228274009-Lifetime non-drinker (finding)

Drug use history supported values:

  • 361055000-Misuses drugs (finding)
  • 228367002-Does not misuse drugs (finding)
  • OTH-Other
  • 44870007-Misused drugs in past (finding)
  • 228368007-Has never misused drugs

Living situation has no default mapping, but can be customized by the Epic organization.

Pregnancy status supported values:

  • 77386006-Pregnancy (finding)
  • UNK-Unknown
  • 60001007-Not pregnant (finding)

Lactation status supported values:

  • 373066001-Yes
  • 373067005-No
  • 261665006-Unknown

Pregnancy intention supported values:

  • 454411000124108-Wants to become pregnant (finding)
  • 454391000124108-Ambivalent about becoming pregnant (finding)
  • 454401000124105-No desire to become pregnant (finding)
  • 454381000124105-Not sure of desire to become pregnant (finding)

valueDateTime.Name: valueDateTime
valueDateTime.Description: Estimated Delivery Date or the start date of the Last Menstrual Period, if applicable.

valueString.Name: valueString
valueString.Description:
Applies only to social documentation.

The text of the social documentation notes.

Data.Description:
The Observation (Labs) resource returns component level data for lab results. Observation is not normally used on its own to access lab results, because it is limited to reading microbiology sensitivities (method level, isolate level, and sensitivity level) and textual (narrative and impression) Observations. Instead, a system queries the DiagnosticReport resource to identify all lab procedures performed for a patient. The DiagnosticReport results will contain pointers to one or more Observation resources that contain the component results. If you are familiar with HL7v2, DiagnosticReport is analogous to an OBR segment, where Observation is like an OBX segment.

For example, consider a CBC (Complete Blood Count) test. The overall CBC test would be represented as a DiagnosticReport resource. The component results (white blood cell count, red blood cell count, hemoglobin, platelet count, etc.) would each be returned in independent Observation resources.

Most systems expect to receive a LOINC code identifying each component. An Observation resource will be returned for a component result even if a LOINC code is not found, however the Observation.code property will be empty.

Some labs, such as pathology or cytology, often file a PDF, or a link to a PDF or other document as the result. We do not currently support returning PDF content or other reference pointer content via FHIR, however the test will be discoverable via a DiagnosticReport search.

For microbiology labs, the DiagnosticReport resource represents the culture. It includes references to Observation for each isolate. The isolates may then either reference an Observation for each method, or, if there is no method provided by the lab system, then the isolate will reference Observations for each sensitivity result. If methods are provided by the lab, then the method Observations will reference the sensitivity results.

The two potential structures are outlined below.

Microbiology results without methods:

  1. Culture (DiagnosticReport)
    1. Isolate A (Observation)
      1. Sensitivity results for antibiotic W (Observation)
      2. Sensitivity results for antibiotic X (Observation)
    2. Isolate B (Observation)
      1. Sensitivity results for antibiotic W (Observation)
      2. Sensitivity results for antibiotic X (Observation)

Microbiology results with methods:

  1. Culture (DiagnosticReport)
    1. Isolate A (Observation)
      1. Method 1 (Observation)
        Sensitivity results for antibiotic W (Observation)
        b. Sensitivity results for antibiotic X (Observation)
      2. Method 2 (Observation)
        Sensitivity results for antibiotic W (Observation)
        b. Sensitivity results for antibiotic X (Observation)
    2. Isolate B (Observation)
      1. Method 1 (Observation)
        Sensitivity results for antibiotic W (Observation)
        b. Sensitivity results for antibiotic X (Observation)
      2. Method 2 (Observation)
        Sensitivity results for antibiotic W (Observation)
        b. Sensitivity results for antibiotic X (Observation)

The category element is populated with SNOMED codes. In November 2021 and later, these codes are based on a mapping from component records to external SNOMED codes. From August 2021 to May 2021, this applies only to Netherlands environments and these codes are based on the value in the Order Type item in Epic.  The following SNOMED codes are supported, and must be mapped in the External Mapping Utility:

  • 252275004-Hematology (Hematologie)
  • 275711006-Chemistry (Klinische chemie)
  • 68793005-Serology (Serologie/ immunologie)
  • 395124008-Virology (Virologie)
  • 314076009-Toxicology (Toxicologie)
  • 19851009-Microbiology (Microbiologie)
  • 405825005-Molecular genetics (Moleculaire genetica)

Starting in February 2024, this subresource can also draw data components linked to Midmark EKG orders. The information in these orders is linked to discrete items on the order (or other associated) records, corresponding to concepts with LOINC codes. In these instances, the category of the Observation is associated with the “Imaging” category as well as the “Laboratory” category. The discrete elements are tied to the following LOINC codes:

  • PR interval- 8625-6
  • P Wave axis- 8626-4
  • QRS duration- 8633-0
  • QRS wave axis- 8632-2
  • QT interval- 8634-8
  • QTC interval- 8636-3
  • T wave axis- 8638-9
  • Diagnostic statements- 8601-7
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

based-on.Name: based-on
based-on.Description: The procedure or service this observation is associated with.

category.Name: category
category.Description:
Use "laboratory" to search for all lab observations. Starting in the November 2021 version of Epic, this parameter also supports the following types of values:

  • Epic order type, such as “Lab”. Supported values vary based on organization-specific configuration.
  • Any of the following SNOMED codes:
    • 252275004-Hematology
    • 275711006-Chemistry
    • 68793005-Serology
    • 395124008-Virology
    • 314076009-Toxicology
    • 19851009-Microbiology
    • 405825005-Molecular genetics
  • Starting in February 2024, "imaging" is supporting.
category.Optional: Either this or code must be provided, but not both.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
The observation identifier.

LOINC code search is supported in all versions.

Starting in the November 2021 version of Epic, this parameter also supports the following types of values which can be searched with or without a system specified (code=[code] or code=[system]|[code]). If specifying a system, the corresponding OID value must be provided.

  • Order component identifiers from the Epic system
  • Other custom identifiers defined by the Epic organization
code.Optional: Either this or category must be provided, but not both.

combo-code.Name: combo-code
combo-code.Description:
The observation identifier.

LOINC code search is supported in all versions.

Starting in the November 2021 version of Epic, this parameter also supports the following types of values which can be searched with or without a system specified (code=[code] or code=[system]|[code]). If specifying a system, the corresponding OID value must be provided.

  • Order component identifiers from the Epic system
  • Other custom identifiers defined by the Epic organization

combo-data-absent-reason.Name: combo-data-absent-reason
combo-data-absent-reason.Description:
The reason why normally expected content of the data element is missing. Set to “unknown” for lab result components with no values. 
This element is available starting in the February 2022 version of Epic.

data-absent-reason.Name: data-absent-reason
data-absent-reason.Description:
The reason why normally expected content of the data element is missing. Set to “unknown” for lab result components with no values. 
This element is available starting in the February 2022 version of Epic.

date.Name: date
date.Description: Date when the specimen was obtained.

derived-from.Name: derived-from
derived-from.Description: The method or isolate level Observation FHIR ID.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: The Encounter FHIR ID linked to the order.

has-member.Name: has-member
has-member.Description:
Values include:

  • has-member
    • used for sensitivity-level observations
  • derived-from
    • used for isolate-level observations

method.Name: method
method.Description: SNOMED code mapped to procedure record in Epic.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: The reference to a patient resource.
patient.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must reference the same patient.

performer.Name: performer
performer.Description: A reference to the resulting agency's director's Practitioner resource.

specimen.Name: specimen
specimen.Description: A reference to the Specimen resource.

status.Description:
The status of the lab order.

For organizations in the Netherlands, this element can also include a TestResultStatus extension that indicates the test result status.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The reference to a patient resource.
subject.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must reference the same patient.

value-string.Name: value-string
value-string.Description: The result value if the result is a string.
