performer.Description: The party responsible for documenting smoking history status. Does not apply to other types of social history data.

status.Name: status
status.Description: If specified, should always be "final" when searching for social history data.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Reference to a patient resource.
subject.Optional: Either this or patient must be provided.

value-concept.Name: value-concept
value-concept.Description: The SNOMED code or other value pertaining to smoking status, alcohol use status, drug use status, living situation, or other social history information. This value might be modified by organization-specific mapping. Refer to the valueCodeableConcept response element for more information.

value-string.Name: value-string
value-string.Description: The text in valueString for this observation, such as the text of the social documentation note.

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: An array of entries included in this bundle.

resource.Name: resource
resource.Description: A container for a single FHIR resource.

Observation.Name: Observation
Observation.Description: An instance of the R4 Observation resource.

category.Name: category
category.Description: This is always "social-history".

code.Name: code
code.Description:
The following value(s), depending on the type of data returned:

  • Smoking history: LOINC code 72166-2 and SNOMED code 365980008
  • Alcohol use history: LOINC code 11331-6 and SNOMED code 228273003
  • Drug use history: LOINC code 11343-1 and SNOMED code 228366006
  • Living situation: SNOMED code 365508006
  • Education: LOINC code LG41797-1
  • Employment history: LOINC code 11341-5
  • Social documentation: LOINC code 29762-2
  • Pregnancy status: LOINC code 82810-3
  • Uterus findings: LOINC code 32486-3
  • Lactation Status: LOINC code 63895-7
  • Menstrual status: LOINC code 3146-8
  • Last menstrual period start-date: LOINC code 8665-2
  • Estimated Delivery Date: LOINC code 11778-8
  • Pregnancy Intention: LOINC code 86645-9

component.Name: component
component.Description:
Applies only to smoking history, alcohol use history, drug use history, and socioeconomic (education and employment) history.

Holds additional detail depending on the type of observation:

Smoking history: Can include one or more of the following code values, paired with either a valueCodeableConcept or a valueQuantity that include additional detail:

  • Tobacco product (LOINC 81228-9; SNOMED 53661000146106)
  • Cigarette pack-years (SNOMED 401201003)
  • Tobacco use duration (LOINC 88029-4)
  • Packs per day (LOINC 8663-7; SNOMED 266918002)

Alcohol use history: The amount of alcohol consumed per day (SNOMED 160573003), expressed in UCUM units as alcoholic_units/day.

Drug use history: Can include one or more of the following code values, paired with either a valueCodeableConcept or a valueString that includes additional detail:

  • Type of substance (LOINC 63643-1; SNOMED 410942007)
  • Frequency of misuse (SNOMED 228390007)

Education: Can include the following code value, paired with either a valueCodeableConcept or valueString that includes additional detail:

  • The patient’s highest level of education (LOINC code 82589-3)

Employment: Can include one or more of the following code values, paired with either a valueCodeableConcept or valueString that includes additional detail:

  • The patient’s occupation (LOINC code LP133724-7)
  • The patient’s employer (LOINC code 80427-8)

code.Name: code
code.Description: CodeableConcept value.

valueCodeableConcept.Name: valueCodeableConcept
valueCodeableConcept.Optional: One of the value* elements is required.

valueQuantity.Name: valueQuantity
valueQuantity.Optional: One of the value* elements is required.

valueString.Name: valueString
valueString.Optional: One of the value* elements is required.

dataAbsentReason.Name: dataAbsentReason
dataAbsentReason.Description: Populated if there is no last menstrual period but there is a last menstrual period comment or precision. Populated if there is no lactation status but there is a lactation status comment.

derivedFrom.Name: derivedFrom
derivedFrom.Description: References the corresponding menstrual status observation from which the pregnancy status is derived from.

issued.Name: issued
issued.Description:
The date when this status is documented. This is set to the date that the status was assessed, if available. Otherwise, this is set to one of the following values to indicate that the response is considered up-to-date as of the specified date:

  • The date of the patient's most recent history encounter, if available.
  • The current date.

The issued date may not be populated for every observation type

note.Name: note
note.Description:
The comments for smoking history, alcohol use history, drug use history, socioeconomic (education and employment) history, last menstrual period, or lactation status. If applicable, this appears within the last menstrual period or lactation status observations.

For organizations in the Netherlands, these are sent in both provider and MyChart contexts.

For all other organizations, these are sent only in a provider context.

performer.Name: performer
performer.Description: The person who documented the status. This is not populated if the status is never assessed.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
This value is always "final".

More detailed status information, such as whether the patient’s smoking status is unknown, can be found by reviewing the values specified in the code element or the valueCodeableConcept element.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient FHIR ID.

valueBoolean.Name: valueBoolean
valueBoolean.Description: Yes/No answer to whether the patient has a uterus.
valueBoolean.Optional: Used for physical findings of uterus.

valueCodeableConcept.Name: valueCodeableConcept
valueCodeableConcept.Description:
The SNOMED code or other value pertaining to smoking status, alcohol use status, drug use status, living situation, pregnancy status, lactation status, or pregnancy intention. Default Epic-to-SNOMED mappings are listed below. This value can also be modified by organization-specific mapping.

Smoking history supported values:

  • 449868002-Smokes tobacco daily (finding)
  • 428041000124106-Current some day smoker
  • 230059006-Occasional cigarette smoker (available in Netherlands environments only)
  • 77176002-Smoker, current status unknown
  • 8517006-Former smoker
  • 266919005-Never smoker
  • 43381005-Passive smoker (available in Netherlands environments only)
  • 266927001-Unknown if ever smoker
  • 266919005-Never smoker
  • 266927001-Unknown if ever smoker
  • 428071000124103-Heavy tobacco smoker
  • 428061000124105-Light tobacco smoker

Alcohol use history supported values:

  • 219006-Current drinker of alcohol (finding)
  • 105542008-Current non-drinker of alcohol (finding)
  • OTH-Other
  • 82581004-Ex-drinker (finding)
  • 228274009-Lifetime non-drinker (finding)

Drug use history supported values:

  • 361055000-Misuses drugs (finding)
  • 228367002-Does not misuse drugs (finding)
  • OTH-Other
  • 44870007-Misused drugs in past (finding)
  • 228368007-Has never misused drugs

Living situation has no default mapping, but can be customized by the Epic organization.

Pregnancy status supported values:

  • 77386006-Pregnancy (finding)
  • UNK-Unknown
  • 60001007-Not pregnant (finding)

Lactation status supported values:

  • 373066001-Yes
  • 373067005-No
  • 261665006-Unknown

Pregnancy intention supported values:

  • 454411000124108-Wants to become pregnant (finding)
  • 454391000124108-Ambivalent about becoming pregnant (finding)
  • 454401000124105-No desire to become pregnant (finding)
  • 454381000124105-Not sure of desire to become pregnant (finding)

valueDateTime.Name: valueDateTime
valueDateTime.Description: The Estimated Delivery Date and/or Last Menstrual Period, if applicable.

valueString.Name: valueString
valueString.Description:
Applies only to social documentation.

The text of the social documentation notes

Data.Description: The read interaction of the Organization resource allows you to look up an organization using a constant server ID. The read interaction allows clients to store only the server ID, and with a single request, retrieve the most up-to-date information about an organization. Read interactions typically begin with a client having previously established a relationship, often through querying for a resource through the search interaction.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

Organization.Name: Organization
Organization.Description: An instance of the R4 Organization FHIR resource.

active.Name: active
active.Description: Whether the organization's record is in active use.

address.Name: address
address.Description: The address from the organization, lab, payer, vendor, pharmacy, place of service, or department.

text.Name: text
text.Description: The organization’s full address as a string. This is formatted based on the country the address is in.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description:
Organization identifier.

Starting in the February 2025 version of Epic (available back to May 2024 via Special Update), this service also returns the internal Epic ID of the service area level of the organization hierarchy.

Starting in the November 2024 version of Epic, for organizations with a National Provider Identifier (NPI), this service returns an identifier type of NPI and the ID of the NPI. For organizations with a Tax Identification Number (TIN), this service returns an identifier type of TIN and the ID of the TIN.

The following organization ID types are supported for organizations in the Netherlands:

ID Type System OID System URL returned in Identifier.system
URA 2.16.528.1.1007.3.3 http://fhir.nl/fhir/NamingSystem/ura
AGB 2.16.840.1.113883.2.4.6.1 http://fhir.nl/fhir/NamingSystem/agb-z
UZOVI 2.16.840.1.113883.2.4.6.4 http://fhir.nl/fhir/NamingSystem/uzovi
NPI   http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/us-npi
TIN 2.16.840.1.113883.4.4

partOf.Name: partOf
partOf.Description: For a department, the revenue location ID.

telecom.Name: telecom
telecom.Description: The phone number, fax number, and emergency phone number.

type.Name: type
type.Description:
The place of service type. Supported starting in August 2020.

This element supports the following extensible bindings:

  • organizationType: The organization type.
  • departmentSpecialty: The department specialty

Data.Description:
The search interaction of the Organization resource allows you to look up organization resources based on the specified search parameters.

Currently, the search interaction supports only the _id search parameter. As a result, it functions similarly to an Organization.Read request.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: An array of entries included in this bundle.

resource.Name: resource
resource.Description: A container for a single FHIR resource.

Organization.Name: Organization
Organization.Description: An instance of the R4 Organization FHIR resource.

active.Name: active
active.Description: Whether the organization's record is in active use.

address.Name: address
address.Description: The address from the organization, lab, payer, vendor, pharmacy, place of service, or department.

text.Name: text
text.Description: The organization’s full address as a string. This is formatted based on the country the address is in.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description:
Organization identifier.

Starting in the February 2025 version of Epic (available back to May 2024 via Special Update), this service also returns the internal Epic ID of the service area level of the organization hierarchy.

Starting in the November 2024 version of Epic, for organizations with a National Provider Identifier (NPI), this service returns an identifier type of NPI and the ID of the NPI. For organizations with a Tax Identification Number (TIN), this service returns an identifier type of TIN and the ID of the TIN.

The following organization ID types are supported for organizations in the Netherlands:

ID Type System OID System URL returned in Identifier.system
URA 2.16.528.1.1007.3.3 http://fhir.nl/fhir/NamingSystem/ura
AGB 2.16.840.1.113883.2.4.6.1 http://fhir.nl/fhir/NamingSystem/agb-z
UZOVI 2.16.840.1.113883.2.4.6.4 http://fhir.nl/fhir/NamingSystem/uzovi
NPI   http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/us-npi
TIN 2.16.840.1.113883.4.4

name.Name: name
name.Description: The name used for the organization.

partOf.Name: partOf
partOf.Description: For a department, the revenue location ID.

telecom.Name: telecom
telecom.Description: The phone number, fax number, and emergency phone number.

type.Name: type
type.Description:
The place of service type. This element supports the following extensible bindings:

  • organizationType: The organization type.
  • departmentSpecialty: The department specialty

Data.Description:
The FHIR Patient resource defines demographics, care providers, and other administrative information about a person receiving care at a health organization.

A user or staff member accessing this FHIR resource must have appropriate security to have search details, demographic details, and/or PCP details included in the Patient resource.

A MyChart user accessing this FHIR resource must be authorized to view patient information in MyChart. Additionally, this FHIR resource returns patient identifiers only to MyChart users with security to see patient IDs.

Additionally, if an Epic organization has configured service area restrictions, the user accessing this FHIR resource must be authorized to view patients in the target service area.

When two patient records are merged, a Patient.Read on the target patient will work normally. The source patient will return a 404 error, as we consider the source patient FHIR ID to be invalid after the merge.

Starting in Epic Version New Features or Changes to the Patient.Read (R4)

May 2025

Patient FHIR responses can now include temporary addresses if the Epic organization has configured temporary addresses to be available in FHIR. Previously temporary addresses were returned only for organizations in Norway or Singapore.

November 2024

Patient FHIR responses can now return patient pronouns.

May 2024

Patient FHIR responses can now return the following pieces of patient data:

  • Legal Sex
  • Gender Identity
  • Tribal Affiliation
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients
Data.Remarks:
You can configure this FHIR resource using the following profile variables:

  • COMM_EQUIP_TYPE_TBL
  • FHIR_SEX_AT_BIRTH_TBL
  • GENDER_TBL
  • GENDER_IDENTITY_CORE_V3_TBL
  • GENDER_IDENTITY_TBL
  • MARITAL_TABLE
  • PCP_TYPES
  • TRIBAL_AFFILIATION_CORE_V3_TBL
Data.ChangeLog:
Epic Version

Description

Type

August 2024 and May 2024 with SU

Patient.Read requests now return temporary addresses for organizations in Norway. Previously, temporary addresses were returned only for organizations in Singapore.

November 2023

The patient-birthTime extension now appears as a child extension on the birthDate element when present, to conform with the FHIR specification. Previously, patient-birthTime was returned as a root-level extension on the Patient resource.

Breaking Change

November 2022

Patient.contact.relationship previously only returned "C" for emergency contact or "E" for employer. When this element is "C" for emergency contact, additional elements about that contact's relationship to the patient are returned.

Non-substantive change

Patient.Name: Patient
Patient.Description: A single instance of a Patient FHIR resource.

_birthDate.Name: _birthDate
_birthDate.Description: Available starting with the November 2023 version of Epic. Extensions for the birthDate element.

birthTime.Name: extension
birthTime.Description: Available starting with the November 2023 version of Epic. The patient's time of birth. This extension follows the HL7 birthTime specification.

dataAbsentReason.Name: extension
dataAbsentReason.Description: Available starting with the November 2024 version of Epic. If the patient’s birth date is not recorded, this extension is returned with a value of “unknown”.

active.Name: active
active.Description: Whether or not the patient record is active.

address.Name: address
address.Description:
The patient's current address, as well as any previous addresses or temporary addresses if applicable.

The patient's current address has a use code of "home". If the patient also has one or more previous addresses, each previous address has a use code of "old". If the patient has a temporary address, it has a use code of "temp".

additionalLocator.Name: extension
additionalLocator.Description:
This extension is returned only for organizations in Singapore.

The patient’s floor.

buildingName.Name: extension
buildingName.Description:
This extension is returned only for organizations in Singapore.

The patient’s building name.

houseNumber.Name: extension
houseNumber.Description: For organizations in the Netherlands and Singapore, this element represents the portion of a patient or contact’s address that is their house number.

period.Name: period
period.Description: The start date – and optionally, end date – that the address is valid for. Always returned for the current address if the information is available. Starting in the May 2025 version of Epic, also returned for previous and temporary addresses if the information is available.

streetName.Name: extension
streetName.Description: For organizations in the Netherlands and Singapore, this element represents the portion of a patient or contact’s address that includes the name of their street.

text.Name: text
text.Description: The patient’s full address as a string. This is formatted based on the country the address is in.

unitID.Name: extension
unitID.Description:
This extension is returned only for organizations in Singapore.

The patient’s unit number.

use.Name: use
use.Description:
The type of address. The value is “home” for a permanent address, “old” for a previous permanent address, or “temp” for a temporary address.

Addresses with a type of “temp” are  returned as noted depending on Epic version:

  • In the May 2025 version of Epic or later: Returned only if the Epic organization has configured temporary addresses to be visible in FHIR responses, regardless of locale.
  • Starting in the August 2024 version of Epic, or the May 2024 version with special updates: Always returned for organizations in Singapore or Norway.
  • In earlier versions: Always returned for organizations in Singapore.

birth location.Name: extension
birth location.Description: The newborn’s birth facility ID, name, address, and phone number.

birth sex.Name: extension
birth sex.Description:
The patient's sex assigned at birth.

This element is not returned for organizations in the Netherlands.

birthDate.Name: birthDate
birthDate.Description: The patient's date of birth in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

birthTime.Name: extension
birthTime.Description: The patient's time of birth. This extension follows the HL7 birthTime specification. Available in versions of Epic before November 2023.

calculated-pronouns-to-use-for-text.Name: extension
calculated-pronouns-to-use-for-text.Description:
Available starting in the November 2023 version of Epic.

The patient's pronouns to use when generating text.

This is an Epic-calculated value based on specified pronouns, the patient's gender identity, or the patient's legal sex. We recommend using extension (individual-pronouns) instead of this one.

One of the following:

  • A value from LOINC Answer List LL5144-2 Personal pronouns
  • EP-PS-DO-NOT-USE-PRONOUNS, from the Epic-defined pronoun set https://open.epic.com/FHIR/Epic/pronoun-set

comment.Name: extension
comment.Description:
This extension is returned only for organizations in the Netherlands.

A comment about the patient’s language proficiency.

The full URL for this extension is “http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/Comment”

communication.Name: communication
communication.Description: A list of languages used to communicate with the patient, along with an indicator of which is preferred.

_preferred.Name: _preferred
_preferred.Description: Additional extensions that provide detail about the patient’s preferred language.

patient-preferenceType.Name: extension
patient-preferenceType.Description: The preferred mode of communication for the patient’s preferred language. This can be either, “verbal” or “written” (from the system http://hl7.org/fhir/language-preference-type).

language.Name: language
language.Description: The patient's general language, onsite care language, and spoken language.

preferred.Name: preferred
preferred.Description: Whether the language is the patient's preferred language.

v3-LanguageAbilityMode.Name: extension
v3-LanguageAbilityMode.Description: Whether the patient is proficient in speaking or writing this language. Can be either “Expressed written” (EWR) or “Expressed spoken” (ESP) (from the system http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-LanguageAbilityMode)

address.Name: address
address.Description:
The contact address.

Not returned for contacts linked to a patient record in patient context.

For organizations in the Netherlands, this element represents an nl-core-address value.

name.Name: name
name.Description:
The contact’s preferred name. The system determines this from the contact’s linked patient record if available.

For contacts linked to a patient record, only the patient's legal first name is returned in patient context.

For organizations in the Netherlands, this element represents an nl-core-humanname value.

humanNameAssemblyOrder.Name: extension
humanNameAssemblyOrder.Description:
This extension is populated only for organizations in the Netherlands.
Name order for the contact. One of the following values:
•	NL1-Own Name
•	NL2-Partner Name
•	NL3-Partner Name followed by Maiden Name
•	NL4-Own Name followed by Partner Name

period.Name: period
period.Description: The contact period.

relationship.Name: relationship
relationship.Description:
The contact’s relationship to the patient. This element can return multiple values. It will always return one or more Epic category values for the contact’s relationship to the patient. In addition, it can return one or more of the following:

  • For organizations in the Netherlands, either a Relationship (RelatieCodelijst) code system value or a role (RolCodelijst) code system value.
  • For all other organizations, can return either a  code system value – such as “C” (emergency contact) or “E” (employer) – or a RoleClass code system value – such as “GUARD” or “AGNT”.

telecom.Name: telecom
telecom.Description:
Telephone numbers and email address for the contact.

Not returned for contacts linked to a patient record in patient context.

For organizations in the Netherlands, this element represents an nl-core-contactpoint value.

deceasedBoolean.Name: deceasedBoolean
deceasedBoolean.Optional: deceasedDateTime is returned whenever available. If not available, deceasedBoolean will be returned.

deceasedDateTime.Name: deceasedDateTime
deceasedDateTime.Description: The date and time of death.
deceasedDateTime.Optional: deceasedDateTime is returned whenever available. If not available, deceasedBoolean will be returned.

ethnicity.Name: extension
ethnicity.Description:
The patient's ethnicity.

This element is not returned for organizations in the Netherlands or Singapore. For other organizations, the value returned depends on the mapping owned by the Epic organization. For organizations in the US, this mapping is typically based on regulatory standards set by the CDC.

gender-identity.Name: extension
gender-identity.Description: The patient’s gender identity. Available starting in the August 2021 version of Epic.

generalPractitioner.Name: generalPractitioner
generalPractitioner.Description: The patient's Primary Care Provider (PCP). Reference to a Practitioner resource.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description:
Unique IDs assigned to the patient.

For organizations in Singapore, the patient’s Document ID, Type and Expiry Date will be sent as one of the identifiers.

period.Name: period
period.Description:
The expiration date of the identifier.

In Singapore, this is the expiration date of the patient’s identification document.

system.Name: system
system.Description: The HL7 root from the IIT

type.Name: type
type.Description:
The patient’s identifier type.

In Singapore, this is the patient’s identification document type.

value.Name: value
value.Description:
The patient’s ID.

In Singapore, this is the patient’s identification document ID.

individual-pronouns.Name: extension
individual-pronouns.Description: The pronouns to use when communicating about an individual. Available starting in the November 2024 version of Epic.

legal-sex.Name: extension
legal-sex.Description: The patient’s legal sex. Available starting in the August 2021 version of Epic.

link.Name: link
link.Description: Starting in February 2024, this returns up to 30 of the most recent merge/unmerge events.

other.Name: other
other.Description: A reference to the patient resource that was merged into the patient resource currently being viewed.

reference.Name: reference
reference.Description: A reference to the patient resource that this patient replaces

patient-merge-unmerge-instant.Name: extension
patient-merge-unmerge-instant.Description: When set to "https://open.epic.com/FHIR/StructureDefinition/patient-merge-unmerge-instant", this item is a valueInstant extension documenting when the patient merge or unmerge occurred.

type.Name: type
type.Description: The type of link between patient resources. This is always set to “replaces”.

managingOrganization.Name: managingOrganization
managingOrganization.Description: The patient’s primary service area. Reference to an Organization resource.

security.Name: security
security.Description:
The patient’s unverified status. Available starting in the May 2024 version of Epic, as well as the February 2024 and November 2023 with special updates.

This is used to track new patient records that may need to be reconciled against existing records in the system. The element is not returned for verified patients. Unverified patients always return the value PATRPT (Patient Reported) along with one of the following values:

  • UNCERTAIN (Uncertain Reliability)
  • UNRELIABLE (Unreliable)

name.Name: name
name.Description:
The patient's name.

  • Starting in the May 2020 version of Epic, this element includes both the patient's "official" name, which is the patient's legal name, and the patient's "usual" name, which is the patient's preferred name.
    • If the patient does not have a preferred name defined in your system, the "usual" name also holds the patient's legal name.
    • In a patient-facing context, this web service always shows the patient's preferred name, unless a user has security point 'Only Show Legal Name'.
  • In the February 2020 version of Epic and earlier, this element returns only the patient's legal name with a use code of "usual".
  • Starting in the November 2020 version of Epic (August 2020, May 2020, and February 2020 with special updates), this element can include the patient’s “old” names, which are aliases or names no longer in use, in addition to the “official” and “usual” names.
  • Starting in the August 2021 version of Epic, names with a use code of “old” can be returned with discrete name elements, such as “given” or “family”.

_given.Name: _given
_given.Description:
This extension is returned if initials or a preferred name are present.

The entity qualifier extension code is IN for initials and is CL for preferred name.

given.Name: given
given.Description: The patient's given name. May include first and middle names.

suffix.Name: suffix
suffix.Description: The patient's name suffix. Acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc.

text.Name: text
text.Description: The patient's full name as a string.

use.Name: use
use.Description: The purpose of the name. May be "legal" or "usual". See the name parameter for full details on use.

patient-preferred-provider-language.Name: extension
patient-preferred-provider-language.Description: The patient's preferred provider language, used for scheduling.

patient-preferred-provider-sex.Name: extension
patient-preferred-provider-sex.Description: The patient's preferred provider sex, used for scheduling.

patient-proficiency.Name: extension
patient-proficiency.Description:
This extension is returned only for organizations in the Netherlands.

Container extension that holds details about the patient’s language proficiency. Contains two child extensions which indicate the type of language proficiency and the level of that proficiency.

The full URL for this extension is “http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/patient-proficiency”

level.Name: extension
level.Description:
Patient's language proficiency level. This is a valueCoding wherein the following code and display values are supported:

  • E – Excellent
  • G – Good
  • F – Fair
  • P – Poor

The system for this valueCoding is “http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-LanguageAbilityProficiency”

type.Name: extension
type.Description:
Patient's language proficiency type. This is a valueCoding wherein the following code and display values are supported:

  • RSP – Received spoken
  • ESP – Expressed spoken
  • RWR – Received written

The system for this valueCoding is “http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-LanguageAbilityMode”

patient-type.Name: extension
patient-type.Description: The type of patient, such as Confidential or Employee.

race.Name: extension
race.Description:
The patient's race.

This element is not returned for organizations in the Netherlands or Singapore. For other organizations, the value returned depends on the mapping owned by the Epic organization. For organizations in the US, this mapping is typically based on regulatory standards set by the CDC.

rendered-value.Name: extension
rendered-value.Description: A rendered version of the value intended for human display.

sex-for-clinical-use.Name: extension
sex-for-clinical-use.Description: The patient’s sex for clinical decision making. This is an Epic-calculated value. If the patient’s sex, gender, and clinical information indicate the patient is not unambiguously a cisgender male or female, the extension is not included. Available starting in the August 2021 version of Epic.

telecom.Name: telecom
telecom.Description: Telephone numbers and email addresses for the patient, along with their use (home or work for example) and their preferred rank (which to contact first, second, third…).

rank.Name: rank
rank.Description:
The priority for the patient's permanent phone numbers or emails.

1 indicates the highest priority phone number, 2 indicates the second priority, and so on.

The preferred email has a rank of 1. Additional emails have a null rank.

Starting in the May 2025 version of Epic, rank is also returned for the phone numbers of patient contacts in the Patient.contact array.

system.Name: system
system.Description:
The type of telecom. Potential values are:

  • email
  • phone

use.Name: use
use.Description:
If the telecom entry is a phone number, possible values are:

  • home
  • mobile
  • work

value.Name: value
value.Description: Value of the telecom method. May be an email address or phone number.

us-core-genderIdentity.Name: extension
us-core-genderIdentity.Description:
The patient’s gender identity.

The full URL for this extension is “http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/StructureDefinition/us-core-genderIdentity”

us-core-sex.Name: extension
us-core-sex.Description: The patient’s sex for clinical decision making.

us-core-tribal-affiliation.Name: extension
us-core-tribal-affiliation.Description:
The patient’s tribal affiliation

The full URL for this extension is “http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/StructureDefinition/us-core-tribal-affiliation”

Data.Description:
Patient.$match Alternative:: If you need to identify a single patient record, strongly consider using Patient.$match instead. This is especially useful for backend integrations where sufficient patient demographics are available. Patient.Search should be used to get a list of patients matching a subset of parameters rather than matching a single patient record. Improper use of Patient.Search could lead to writing data on the wrong patient record and even patient safety concerns.

This web service allows filtering or searching for patients based on a number of parameters, and retrieves patient demographic information from a patient's chart for each matching patient record. This service also does not respect the same filtering as MyChart, with the exception of the careProvider parameter.

A user or staff member accessing this FHIR resource must have appropriate security to have search details, demographic details, and/or PCP details included in the Patient resource.

A MyChart user accessing this FHIR resource must be authorized to view patient information in MyChart. Additionally, this FHIR resource returns patient identifiers only to MyChart users with security to see patient IDs.

If an Epic organization has configured service area restrictions, the user accessing this FHIR resource must also be authorized to view patients in the target service area.

When two patient records are merged, a Patient.Search on the target patient will work normally. The source patient will return a 404 error, as we consider the source patient FHIR ID to be invalid after the merge.

Starting in Epic Version

New Features or Changes to Patient.Search (R4)

May 2025

Patient FHIR responses can now include temporary addresses if the Epic organization has configured temporary addresses to be available in FHIR. Previously temporary addresses were returned only for organizations in Norway or Singapore.

November 2024

Patient FHIR responses can now return patient pronouns.

May 2024

Patient FHIR responses can now return the following pieces of data:

  • Legal Sex
  • Gender Identity
  • Tribal Affiliation

November 2022

A new operation, Patient.$match (R4), has been released. Epic now recommends using Patient.$match for most patient-searching use cases, because it is designed to find specific patients with high confidence.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients
Data.ChangeLog:
Epic Version

Description

Type

August 2024 and May 2024 with SU

Patient.Read requests now return temporary addresses for organizations in Norway. Previously, temporary addresses were returned only for organizations in Singapore.

November 2023

The patient-birthTime extension now appears as a child extension on the birthDate element when present, to conform with the FHIR specification. Previously, patient-birthTime was returned as a root-level extension on the Patient resource.

Breaking Change

November 2022

Patient.contact.relationship previously only returned "C" for emergency contact or "E" for employer. When this element is "C" for emergency contact, additional elements about that contact's relationship to the patient are returned.

Non-substantive change

active.Name: active
active.Description: Whether the patient record is active.

address.Name: address
address.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

address-city.Name: address-city
address-city.Description: The city for patient's home address.
address-city.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

address-postalcode.Name: address-postalcode
address-postalcode.Description: The postal code for patient's home address.
address-postalcode.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

address-state.Name: address-state
address-state.Description: The state for the patient's home address.
address-state.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

address-use.Name: address-use
address-use.Description: The use code for the address.

birthdate.Name: birthdate
birthdate.Description: The patient's date of birth in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
birthdate.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

death-date.Name: death-date
death-date.Description: The date and time of death.

family.Name: family
family.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

gender.Name: gender
gender.Description: The patient's legal sex. Starting in the August 2021 version of Epic, the legal-sex parameter is preferred.
gender.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

given.Name: given
given.Description: The patient's given name. May include first and middle names.
given.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description:
The patient's identifier.

Starting in November 2018, this web service supports using ID and ID type combinations, such as Patient?identifier=MRN|202497.
identifier.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

legal-sex.Name: legal-sex
legal-sex.Description: The patient’s legal sex. Takes precedence over the gender search parameter. Available starting in the August 2021 version of Epic.
legal-sex.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

name.Name: name
name.Description: Any part of the patient's name. When discrete name parameters are used, such as family or given, this parameter is ignored.
name.Optional:
Name can be used in place of providing both family and given.

Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

own-name.Name: own-name
own-name.Description: The patient's own last name. Usually used in non-US names.
own-name.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

own-prefix.Name: own-prefix
own-prefix.Description: The patient's own prefix. Usually used in non-US names.
own-prefix.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

partner-name.Name: partner-name
partner-name.Description: The patient's spouse's last name. Usually used in non-US names.
partner-name.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

partner-prefix.Name: partner-prefix
partner-prefix.Description: The patient's spouse's prefix. Usually used in non-US names.
partner-prefix.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

telecom.Name: telecom
telecom.Description: The patient's phone number or email.
telecom.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: An array of entries included in this bundle.

resource.Name: resource
resource.Description: A container for a single FHIR resource.

Patient.Name: Patient
Patient.Description: A single instance of a Patient FHIR resource.

_birthDate.Name: _birthDate
_birthDate.Description: Available starting with the November 2023 version of Epic. Extensions for the birthDate element.

birthTime.Name: extension
birthTime.Description: Available starting with the November 2023 version of Epic. The patient's time of birth. This extension follows the HL7 birthTime specification.

dataAbsentReason.Name: extension
dataAbsentReason.Description: Available starting with the November 2024 version of Epic. If the patient’s birth date is not recorded, this extension is returned with a value of “unknown”.

active.Name: active
active.Description: Whether the patient record is active.

address.Name: address
address.Description:
The patient's current address, as well as any previous addresses or temporary addresses if applicable.

The patient's current address has a use code of "home". If the patient also has one or more previous addresses, each previous address has a use code of "old". If the patient has a temporary address, it has a use code of "temp".

additionalLocator.Name: extension
additionalLocator.Description:
This extension is returned only for organizations in Singapore.

The patient’s floor.

buildingName.Name: extension
buildingName.Description:
This extension is returned only for organizations in Singapore.

The patient’s building name.

houseNumber.Name: extension
houseNumber.Description: For organizations in the Netherlands and Singapore, this element represents the portion of a patient or contact’s address that is their house number.

period.Name: period
period.Description: The start date – and optionally, end date – that the address is valid for. Always returned for the current address if the information is available. Starting in the May 2025 version of Epic, also returned for previous and temporary addresses if the information is available.

streetName.Name: extension
streetName.Description: For organizations in the Netherlands and Singapore, this element represents the portion of a patient or contact’s address that includes the name of their street.

text.Name: text
text.Description: The patient’s full address as a string. This is formatted based on the country the address is in.

unitID.Name: extension
unitID.Description:
This extension is returned only for organizations in Singapore.

The patient’s unit number.

use.Name: use
use.Description:
The type of address. The value is “home” for a permanent address, “old” for a previous permanent address, or “temp” for a temporary address.

Addresses with a type of “temp” are  returned as noted depending on Epic version:

  • In the May 2025 version of Epic or later: Returned only if the Epic organization has configured temporary addresses to be visible in FHIR responses, regardless of locale.
  • Starting in the August 2024 version of Epic, or the May 2024 version with special updates: Always returned for organizations in Singapore or Norway.
  • In earlier versions: Always returned for organizations in Singapore.

birth location.Name: extension
birth location.Description: The newborn’s birth facility ID, name, address, and phone number.

birth sex.Name: extension
birth sex.Description:
The patient's sex assigned at birth.

This element is not returned for organizations in the Netherlands.

birthDate.Name: birthDate
birthDate.Description: The patient's date of birth in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

birthTime.Name: extension
birthTime.Description: The patient's time of birth. This extension follows the HL7 birthTime specification. Available in versions of Epic before November 2023.

calculated-pronouns-to-use-for-text.Name: extension
calculated-pronouns-to-use-for-text.Description:
Available starting in the November 2023 version of Epic.

The patient's pronouns to use when generating text.

This is an Epic-calculated value based on specified pronouns, the patient's gender identity, or the patient's legal sex. We recommend using extension (individual-pronouns) instead of this one.

One of the following:

  • A value from LOINC Answer List LL5144-2 Personal pronouns
  • EP-PS-DO-NOT-USE-PRONOUNS, from the Epic-defined pronoun set https://open.epic.com/FHIR/Epic/pronoun-set

comment.Name: extension
comment.Description:
This extension is returned only for organizations in the Netherlands.

A comment about the patient’s language proficiency.

The full URL for this extension is “http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/Comment”

communication.Name: communication
communication.Description: A list of languages used to communicate with the patient, along with an indicator of which is preferred.

_preferred.Name: _preferred
_preferred.Description: Additional extensions that provide detail about the patient’s preferred language.

patient-preferenceType.Name: extension
patient-preferenceType.Description: The preferred mode of communication for the patient’s preferred language. This can be either, “verbal” or “written” (from the system http://hl7.org/fhir/language-preference-type).

language.Name: language
language.Description: The patient's general language, onsite care language, and spoken language.

preferred.Name: preferred
preferred.Description: Whether the language is the patient's preferred language.

v3-LanguageAbilityMode.Name: extension
v3-LanguageAbilityMode.Description: Whether the patient is proficient in speaking or writing this language. Can be either “Expressed written” (EWR) or “Expressed spoken” (ESP) (from the system http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-LanguageAbilityMode)

address.Name: address
address.Description:
The contact address.

Not returned for contacts linked to a patient record in patient context.

For organizations in the Netherlands, this element represents an nl-core-address value.

name.Name: name
name.Description:
The contact’s preferred name. The system determines this from the contact’s linked patient record if available.

For contacts linked to a patient record, only the patient's legal first name is returned in patient context.

For organizations in the Netherlands, this element represents an nl-core-humanname value.

humanNameAssemblyOrder.Name: extension
humanNameAssemblyOrder.Description:
This extension is populated only for organizations in the Netherlands.

Name order for the contact. One of the following values:

  • NL1-Own Name
  • NL2-Partner Name
  • NL3-Partner Name followed by Maiden Name
  • NL4-Own Name followed by Partner Name

period.Name: period
period.Description: The contact period.

relationship.Name: relationship
relationship.Description:
The contact’s relationship to the patient. This element can return multiple values. It will always return one or more Epic category values for the contact’s relationship to the patient. In addition, it can return one or more of the following:

  • For organizations in the Netherlands, either a Relationship (RelatieCodelijst) code system value or a role (RolCodelijst) code system value.
  • For all other organizations, can return either a  code system value – such as “C” (emergency contact) or “E” (employer) – or a RoleClass code system value – such as “GUARD” or “AGNT”.

telecom.Name: telecom
telecom.Description:
Telephone numbers and email address for the contact.

Not returned for contacts linked to a patient record in patient context.

For organizations in the Netherlands, this element represents an nl-core-contactpoint value.

deceasedBoolean.Name: deceasedBoolean
deceasedBoolean.Optional: deceasedDateTime is returned whenever available. If not available, deceasedBoolean will be returned.

deceasedDateTime.Name: deceasedDateTime
deceasedDateTime.Description: The date and time of death.
deceasedDateTime.Optional: deceasedDateTime is returned whenever available. If not available, deceasedBoolean will be returned.

ethnicity.Name: extension
ethnicity.Description:
The patient's ethnicity.

This element is not returned for organizations in the Netherlands or Singapore. For other organizations, the value returned depends on the mapping owned by the Epic organization. For organizations in the US, this mapping is typically based on regulatory standards set by the CDC.

gender-identity.Name: extension
gender-identity.Description: The patient’s gender identity. Available starting in the August 2021 version of Epic.

generalPractitioner.Name: generalPractitioner
generalPractitioner.Description: The patient's Primary Care Provider (PCP). Reference to a Practitioner resource.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description:
Unique IDs assigned to the patient.


For organizations in Singapore, the patient’s Document ID, Type and Expiry Date will be sent as one of the identifiers.

period.Name: period
period.Description:
The expiration date of the identifier.

 

In Singapore, this is the expiration date of the patient’s identification document.

system.Name: system
system.Description: The HL7 root from the IIT

type.Name: type
type.Description:
The patient’s identifier type.

 

In Singapore, this is the patient’s identification document type.

value.Name: value
value.Description:
The patient’s ID.

 

In Singapore, this is the patient’s identification document ID.

individual-pronouns.Name: extension
individual-pronouns.Description: The pronouns to use when communicating about an individual. Available starting in the November 2024 version of Epic.

legal-sex.Name: extension
legal-sex.Description: The patient’s legal sex.   Available starting in the August 2021 version of Epic.

link.Name: link
link.Description: Starting in February 2024, this returns up to 30 of the most recent merge/unmerge events.

other.Name: other
other.Description: A reference to the patient resource that was merged into the patient resource currently being viewed.

reference.Name: reference
reference.Description: A reference to the patient resource that this patient replaces

patient-merge-unmerge-instant.Name: extension
patient-merge-unmerge-instant.Description: When set to "https://open.epic.com/FHIR/StructureDefinition/patient-merge-unmerge-instant", this item is a valueInstant extension documenting when the patient merge or unmerge occurred.

type.Name: type
type.Description: The type of link between patient resources. This is always set to “replaces”.

managingOrganization.Name: managingOrganization
managingOrganization.Description: The patient’s primary service area. Reference to an Organization resource.

security.Name: security
security.Description:
The patient’s unverified status. This is used to track new patient records that may need to be reconciled against existing records in the system. The element is not returned for verified patients. Unverified patients always return the value PATRPT (Patient Reported) along with one of the following values:

  • UNCERTAIN (Uncertain Reliability)
  • UNRELIABLE (Unreliable)

Available starting in the May 2024 version of Epic, as well as February 2024 and November 2023 with special updates.

name.Name: name
name.Description:
The patient's name.

  • Starting in the May 2020 version of Epic, this element includes both the patient's "official" name, which is the patient's legal name, and the patient's "usual" name, which is the patient's preferred name.
    • If the patient does not have a preferred name defined in your system, the "usual" name also holds the patient's legal name.
    • In a patient-facing context, this web service always shows the patient's preferred name, unless a user has security point 'Only Show Legal Name'.
  • In the February 2020 version of Epic and earlier, this element returns only the patient's legal name with a use code of "usual".
  • Starting in the November 2020 version of Epic (August 2020, May 2020, and February 2020 with special updates), this element can include the patient’s “old” names, which are aliases or names no longer in use, in addition to the “official” and “usual” names.
  • Starting in the August 2021 version of Epic, names with a use code of “old” can be returned with discrete name elements, such as “given” or “family”.

_given.Name: _given
_given.Description:
This extension is returned if initials or a preferred name are present.

The entity qualifier extension code is IN for initials and is CL for preferred name.

given.Name: extension
given.Description:
This extension is returned if initials or a preferred name are present.

The entity qualifier extension code is IN for initials and is CL for preferred name.

family.Name: family
family.Description:
The patient's family (last) name.

Starting in the August 2021 version of Epic, can contain a data-absent-reason extension with a value of "unknown" if the patient has an alias that cannot be returned as discrete elements.

given.Name: given
given.Description: The patient's given name. May include first and middle names.

suffix.Name: suffix
suffix.Description: The patient's name suffix. Acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc.

text.Name: text
text.Description: The patient's full name as a string.

use.Name: use
use.Description: The purpose of the name. May be "official", "usual", or "old". See the name parameter for full details on use.

patient-preferred-provider-language.Name: extension
patient-preferred-provider-language.Description: The patient's preferred provider language, used for scheduling.

patient-preferred-provider-sex.Name: extension
patient-preferred-provider-sex.Description: The patient's preferred provider sex, used for scheduling.

patient-proficiency.Name: extension
patient-proficiency.Description:
This extension is returned only for organizations in the Netherlands.

Container extension that holds details about the patient’s language proficiency. Contains two child extensions which indicate the type of language proficiency and the level of that proficiency.

The full URL for this extension is “http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/patient-proficiency”

level.Name: extension
level.Description:
Patient's language proficiency level. This is a valueCoding wherein the following code and display values are supported:

  • E – Excellent
  • G – Good
  • F – Fair
  • P – Poor

The system for this valueCoding is “http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-LanguageAbilityProficiency”

type.Name: extension
type.Description:
Patient's language proficiency type. This is a valueCoding wherein the following code and display values are supported:

  • RSP – Received spoken
  • ESP – Expressed spoken
  • RWR – Received written

The system for this valueCoding is “http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-LanguageAbilityMode”

patient-type.Name: extension
patient-type.Description: The type of patient, such as Confidential or Employee.

race.Name: extension
race.Description:
The patient's race.

This element is not returned for organizations in the Netherlands or Singapore. For other organizations, the value returned depends on the mapping owned by the Epic organization. For organizations in the US, this mapping is typically based on regulatory standards set by the CDC.

rendered-value.Name: extension
rendered-value.Description: A rendered version of the value intended for human display.

sex-for-clinical-use.Name: extension
sex-for-clinical-use.Description: The patient’s sex for clinical decision making. This is an Epic-calculated value. If the patient’s sex, gender, and clinical information indicate the patient is not unambiguously a cisgender male or female, the extension is not included. Available starting in the August 2021 version of Epic.

telecom.Name: telecom
telecom.Description: Telephone numbers and email addresses for the patient, along with their use (home or work for example) and their preferred rank (which to contact first, second, third…).

rank.Name: rank
rank.Description:
The priority for the patient's permanent phone numbers or emails.

1 indicates the highest priority phone number, 2 indicates the second priority, and so on.

The preferred email has a rank of 1. Additional emails have a null rank.

Starting in the May 2025 version of Epic, rank is also returned for the phone numbers of patient contacts in the Patient.contact array.

system.Name: system
system.Description:
The type of telecom. Potential values are:

  • email
  • phone

use.Name: use
use.Description:
If the telecom entry is a phone number, possible values are:

  • home
  • mobile
  • work

value.Name: value
value.Description: Value of the telecom method. May be an email address or phone number.

us-core-genderIdentity.Name: extension
us-core-genderIdentity.Description:
The patient’s gender identity.

The full URL for this extension is “http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/StructureDefinition/us-core-genderIdentity”

us-core-sex.Name: extension
us-core-sex.Description: The patient’s sex for clinical decision making.

us-core-tribal-affiliation.Name: extension
us-core-tribal-affiliation.Description:
The patient’s tribal affiliation

The full URL for this extension is “http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/StructureDefinition/us-core-tribal-affiliation”

security.Name: security
security.Description:
The patient’s unverified status. Available starting in the May 2024 version of Epic, as well as the February 2024 and November 2023 with special updates.

This is used to track new patient records that may need to be reconciled against existing records in the system. The element is not returned for verified patients. Unverified patients always return the value PATRPT (Patient Reported) along with one of the following values:

  • UNCERTAIN (Uncertain Reliability)
  • UNRELIABLE (Unreliable)

Data.Description:
The FHIR Procedure resource defines an activity performed on or with a patient as part of the provision of care. It corresponds with surgeries and procedures performed, including endoscopies and biopsies, as well as less invasive actions like counseling and physiotherapy. Because terminology codes for procedures are often billing related, some procedures might not have a terminology code, especially when billing activities are not performed within Epic.

This resource is designed for a high-level summarization around the occurrence of a procedure, and not for specific procedure log documentation - a concept that does not yet have a defined FHIR Resource. When searching, only completed procedures are returned.

The read interaction enables the lookup of a Procedure resource by a constant server ID. The read interaction allows clients to store only the server ID, and with a single request, retrieve the most up-to-date information about a procedure. Read interactions typically begin with a client having previously established a relationship, typically when following a reference to this resource from another resource or through querying for procedures through the search interaction.

A user or staff member accessing this FHIR resource must have security to view orders, results, and procedure reports.

A MyChart user accessing this FHIR resource must be authorized to view procedures in MyChart.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

Data.Description:
The FHIR Procedure resource defines an activity performed on or with a patient as part of the provision of care. It corresponds with surgeries and procedures performed, including endoscopies and biopsies, as well as less invasive actions like counseling and physiotherapy. Because terminology codes for procedures are often billing related, some procedures might not have a terminology code, especially when billing activities are not performed within Epic.

The Procedure (Surgeries) API is designed to summarize any performed surgical procedures for a patient. Other types of procedures may be returned in other APIs, such as the Procedure (Orders) API for procedures created from orders.

This resource is designed for a high-level summarization around the occurrence of a procedure, and not for specific procedure log documentation - a concept that does not yet have a defined FHIR Resource.

The read interaction enables the lookup of a Procedure resource by a constant server ID. Read interactions begin with a client having previously established a relationship, typically when following a reference to this resource from another resource or through querying for procedures through the search interaction.

Data.Description:
The FHIR Procedure resource defines an activity performed on or with a patient as part of the provision of care. It corresponds with surgeries and procedures performed, including endoscopies and biopsies, as well as less invasive actions like counseling and physiotherapy.

This resource is designed for a high-level summarization around the occurrence of a procedure, and not for specific procedure log documentation - a concept that does not yet have a defined FHIR Resource. When searching, only completed procedures are returned.

A user or staff member accessing this FHIR resource must have security to view orders, results, and procedure reports.

A MyChart user accessing this FHIR resource must be authorized to view procedures in MyChart.

To gather a complete list of surgical procedure information for a patient , three different Procedure APIs must be consulted. While a surgical procedure may be documented in multiple places in Epic, it will be returned only by one Procedure FHIR API, in the following order of precedence:

  1. Procedure (Orders): Includes any procedure that is ordered by a clinician and completed during an encounter. If a procedure is returned by this API, it won’t be returned by the Procedure (Surgeries) or Procedure (Surgical History) APIs.
  2. Procedure (Surgeries): Includes surgical procedures attached to a surgical log. If a procedure is returned by this API, it won’t be returned by the Procedure (Surgical History) API.
  3. Procedure (Surgical History): Includes any manually documented surgical history or pertinent negatives that were not documented on a surgical log or ordered within Epic.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients

Data.Description:
The FHIR Procedure resource defines an activity performed on or with a patient as part of the provision of care. It corresponds with surgeries and procedures performed, including endoscopies and biopsies, as well as less invasive actions like counseling and physiotherapy.

The Procedure (Surgeries) API is designed to summarize any performed surgical procedures for a patient. Other types of procedures may be returned in other APIs, such as the Procedure (Orders) API for procedures created from orders.

Organizations can have differences when determining which performable activities are classified as procedures, so the types of activities included in FHIR Procedure search can vary between organizations.

Because terminology codes for procedures are often billing related, some procedures might not have a standard code (for example, CPT), especially when billing activities are not performed within Epic. For organizations that do perform billing activities within Epic, procedures might not have a CPT code until the charges are generated for the procedure.

This resource is designed for a high-level summarization around the occurrence of a procedure, and not for specific procedure log documentation - a concept that does not yet have a defined FHIR Resource. When searching, only completed procedures are returned.

To gather a complete list of surgical procedure information for a patient , three different Procedure APIs must be consulted. While a surgical procedure may be documented in multiple places in Epic, it will be returned only by one Procedure FHIR API, in the following order of precedence:

  1. Procedure (Orders): Includes any procedure that is ordered by a clinician and completed during an encounter. If a procedure is returned by this API, it won’t be returned by the Procedure (Surgeries) or Procedure (Surgical History) APIs.
  2. Procedure (Surgeries): Includes surgical procedures attached to a surgical log. If a procedure is returned by this API, it won’t be returned by the Procedure (Surgical History) API.
  3. Procedure (Surgical History): Includes any manually documented surgical history or pertinent negatives that were not documented on a surgical log or ordered within Epic.
Data.UsageScopes: Backend Systems and Non-OAuth 2.0, Clinicians or Administrative Users, Patients
